The group wants to strengthen its partnership with Soro Yiriwaso so that stock levels remain high.

loans.use: To buy seasoning.

loans.name: Kodjovi

texts.fr: Kodjovi est un homme de 53ans. Il est marié à une revendeuse et a 07enfants dont 04 à l’école. Le premier a 29ans et le dernier 07ans.  Mr Kodzovi est comptable et gérant de pressing. Il a commencé cette activité en 2011 et est aidé par 04 personnes. Il sollicite ce premier prêt pour réaménager le local. Il veut  rénover le local et acheter deux machines afin d’effectuer plus de rendement. Il veut assurer aussi les besoins primaires de la famille.
texts.en: Kodjovi is 53 years of age and is married to a retailer. They have seven children, four of whom go to school. The oldest child is 29, while the youngest is seven. Kodjovi is an accountant and manages a dry-cleaners. He began this activity in 2011, and is helped by four people. He has requested this first loan to refurbish his premises. He wants to renovate his premises and purchase two machines so that he can increase productivity. He also wants to ensure that his family’s basic needs are covered.

loans.use: To refurbish his premises.

loans.name: Maria Sonnia

texts.es: María está casada con Wilson, es bachiller, tiene 45 años de edad. Nació en Manabí y actualmente tiene una casa en Guayaquil. Nos indica que no se siente extraña porque muchos de sus vecinos son de diferentes partes del país. No ha olvidado sus orígenes ya que tiene familiares en Manabí, por eso cuando tiene tiempo va de visita. María tiene un hijo de 15 años que estudia en la escuela fiscal. Su esposo es albañil por lo que no tiene trabajo fijo por ende la necesidad la obligo a vender almuerzos, no se arrepiente porque le fue muy bien y con ello pudo abrir un bazar. Nos cuenta que su inversión fue acertada, ahora ella y su esposo manejan el negocio. El préstamo lo quiere invertir en aumentar y surtir el inventario comprando cuadernos, plumas, arroz y snack. Su meta próxima es agrandar su negocio ya que tiene mucha clientela.
texts.en:
María is married to Wilson.  She’s a high school graduate and is 45 years old.  She was born in Manabí and currently has a house in Guayaquil.  She indicates that she doesn’t feel strange because lots of her neighbors are from different parts of the country.  She hasn’t forgotten her origins, though, since she has relatives in Manabí so when she has time she goes to visit.

María has a 15 year old son attending public school.  Her husband works in construction so he does not have steady employment which forced her into selling breakfasts.  She doesn’t regret it because she did very well and with that was able to open a variety store.  She tells us that her investment was on target and now she and her husband run the business.

She wants to use the loan to increase stock inventory buying notebooks, pens, rice and snacks.  Her next goal is to enlarge her store because she has a large clientele.

loans.use: to buy notebooks and pens.

loans.name: Maria De La Luz

texts.es:
La señora María es casada, con 37 años de edad, es madre de tres hijos que van a la escuela y colegio, ella vive en una aldea al sur de Honduras.
 Doña María se dedica desde hace 5 años a la venta de pollo frito, tacos, enchiladas, tajaditas de plátano verde y refrescos, ella esta solicitando a PRISMA un préstamo por la cantidad de 15,000.00 lempiras para comprar  Pollos, mínimos verdes, repollo, plátanos, refrescos y otros productos para hacer las golosinas, con el apoyo de este préstamo a su negocio Doña María mejorara sus ingresos ya que es una mujer que se esfuerza día con día para sacar adelante a su familia.
El sueño de Doña María es que sus hijos se gradúen y también le gustaría mejorar su vivienda.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2012
texts.en:
María, 37, is married and the mother of three children attending elementary and secondary school; she lives in a village in south Honduras.

María has been selling fried chicken, tacos, enchiladas, fried greed plantain and soft-drinks for five years.  She’s asking PRISMA for a 15,000 lempira loan to buy chickens, green bananas, cabbage, bananas, soft-drinks and other ingredients to make snacks.  With support from this loan María will improve her income since she’s a woman who strives daily to support her family.  María’s dream is that her children graduate and she’d also like to do some home improvements.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – March, 2012

loans.use: to buy chicken, green bananas, cabbage, bananas, soft-drinks and other products.

loans.name: Arevik

texts.en: Arevik is 50 years old. She lives in Syunik village with her daughter. Arevik works for one of the local greenhouses, where she coordinates the work. Besides that, Arevik is also involved in beekeeping and now has 25 beehives. She wants to develop her own business to have an independent source of income, which comes from making and selling honey in the village and in nearby Kapan city. Development of beekeeping will allow Arevik to earn more income and live with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for beehives.

loans.name: Sâr

texts.en:
Sâr is 31 years old, a married woman who has two single children attending school. She provides them daily allowances and food with the income she generates from rice husbandry. She has been in the business for more than 13 years. Sâr described herself as a low-educated woman who struggles to work hard to provide her children a good education. She said that only education can alleviate poverty and she doesn’t want them to follow the path of difficulties she has experienced in her life.

At the present, Sâr would like to take out a loan of KHR 4,000,000 to buy timbers for the repair of her house.  With any left amount, she will purchase a used motorcycle for home use purposes in order to satisfy her living needs. In the future, she hopes that she will be able to expand her business and lift her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy timbers for the repair of her house.

loans.name: Yoeun

texts.en:
Yoeun, 31, is one of the residents from Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She owns and operates a rice farming business, from which she is able to generate her daily income of about USD 5.00 per day. She and her spouse work hard to give their family a better quality of life. She mainly spends her income for daily foods and pays for her children’s allowances. She is responsible for two single children attending school.

In this regard, Yoeun plans to improve her business and make it sustainable with her daily income. Because of financial shortages, she would like to apply for a loan of KHR 2,000,000 to purchase a cow for her farm. She believes that this loan will help her manage her business well and cut down some expenses. In the future, she hopes to continually support her children until they finish at least high school level.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for the farm.

loans.name: Mong

texts.en:
Mong is 40 years old, married, and has four children.  She lives in peaceful village in a suburb area of Phnom Penh. She is working her hard to improve her standard of living. She has operated a rice farming business for many years. Her husband provides transportation service around the commune and contributes his income to support the family. 

Mong is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase a young cow for the maintenance of the rice field. With the remainder of the loan, she will fix some broken parts of her house. Mong dreams of having a good house since it is old and not safe for the family to live in.

loans.use: to purchase a young cow for the maintenance of the rice field.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Del Rancho De Teja Group

texts.es:
La señora Sebastiana esta casada, tiene 39 años de edad, no tuvo oportunidad de esutidiar, tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 2 están estudiando, se dedica al comercio a la venta de ropa para damas y caballeros, inicio este negocio con poco capital y hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al mismo negocio.

organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo, que lo utilizara para la compra de mercadería, pañuelos, playeras, sweteres, ponchos, camisas, pantalones, etc. Espera en el futuro tener un negocio bien establecido. Las demás  integrantes del grupo se dedica al comercio, servicio de molino y a la crianza de animales.
texts.en:
Sebastiana, 39, is married.  She never had the opportunity to go to school.  She has six children two of which are attending school.  She is a merchant; she sells women’s and men’s clothing.  She started the business with little capital and to date has ten years’ experience.  Her husband is in the same kind of business and she has his support.

She organized a group to request a loan that will be used to buy merchandise like handkerchiefs, t-shirts, sweaters, ponchos, shirts, pants, etc.  She hopes in the future to have a well-established business.

The other group members work in commerce, mill services and raising livestock.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Sona

texts.en:
Sona is 30 years old. She lives in Aghitu village and is happily married with two children. Sona's parents-in-law also live with them. Sona and her family have been involved in agriculture for 8 years. They grow potatoes and beans and keep beehives. 

Sona needs some financial investments to start land cultivation and to improve her farm. With the help of this loan she will purchase potato and bean seeds as well as fertilizer and fuel for agricultural purposes. Sona also wants to purchase new hives for the bees, as well as medicine and frames for the hives. This loan is important for Sona to continue development of the farm, which will provide financial stability for her family and her children.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fertilizer, fuel, frames, hives and medicine.

loans.name: Gurgen

texts.en:
Gurgen is a young farmer from Geghanush village, Armenia. He lives with his father, who is a teacher at the local school, and sister. Gurgen works at a poultry fabric. He is also involved in beekeeping. The income from the sales of honey is very important for Gurgen to support his family. 

Gurgen has plans to develop beekeeping, for which he wants to purchase new beehives. Thus he has applied for this loan. 
Gurgen dreams of starting his own family and insuring them with a prosperous life. Development of beekeeping will create the necessary prerequisites for him to make his dream come true.

loans.use: to purchase beehives

loans.name: Melikset

texts.en: Melikset is 55 years old. He lives in Jermuk town, Armenia, with his wife. This town is famous for its mineral water with its health improving properties. He works at the local factory of mineral water as a mechanic. He also runs a farm where he keeps beehives. The number of beehives is currently 31. He would like to develop his beekeeping, for which he wants to purchase 20 more beehives. Development of beekeeping means additional income for Melikset, which will provide him financial stability currently and after retirement from his work at the factory.

loans.use: to pay for 20 beehives.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 25 years old. She lives in the town of Sisian with her husband and parents-in-law. Anna works at the medical center as a nurse. Her husband is a police officer. Besides their main work, Anna and her husband run a farm, where they cultivate land and grow fruit trees. Anna's parents-in-law help them with daily agricultural activities. 

Ann has applied for this loan to get the necessary means for starting land cultivation. With the loan's help she plans to purchase 1000 kg barley seeds, 700 kg potato seeds and 25 bags of fertilizer. Successful cultivation of the land will allow Anna to gather a good harvest of barley and potatoes, sell them and earn additional income.

loans.use: to pay for barley and potato seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Don Jorge tiene 39 años de edad, es casado y tiene 5 hijos, su esposa tiene venta de abarrotería, mientras que el se dedica al cultivo de café y a la agricultura. Inició a dedicarse al cultivo de café por su propio esfuerzo e iniciativa, y sus ganas de salir adelante. Trabaja diariamente desde las 5 am hasta las 4 pm y lo hace en conjunto con algunos de sus hijos, cuando es la temporada de cosecha se trabaja a tiempo completo ya que hay trabajo abundante y no se da abasto. Hasta el momento las dificultades que se le han presentado es que en temporada de corte de café no se encuentra suficiente mano de obra por lo que el café se le cae y por lo tanto tiene algunas perdidas, en algunas ocasiones no tiene dinero para pagar la mano de obra. La ventaja que tiene don Jorge es que hay mucha demanda en la venta de café y se lo pagan a un buen precio. El préstamo que don Jorge solicita lo necesita comprar abono y chapiar la tierra para la siembra de café y el pago de mano de obra. Una de sus metas es tener una mayor plantación de café. Es su primer ciclo en FAMA y piensa invertir muy bien el dinero para luego pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Jorge is 39 years old, and is married with five children. His wife sells groceries, while he works in agriculture and cultivates coffee. He started growing coffee on his own initiative and effort, because he was eager to get ahead. 
He works daily from 5 am until 4 pm, and does so along with some of his children. During the harvest season there is full time work and there is so much work that he can't cope with all of it. The difficculties that have risen so far are that during the coffee cutting season there isn't enough manpower available, so the coffee beans fall off and he suffers some losses. At times, he does not have enough money to pay for labor. The advantage Jorge has is that there is a high demand for coffee and he gets paid a good price. 
Jorge needs the loan he is requesting to purchase fertilizer and clear the land in order to plant the coffee beans, and to pay for labor. One of his goals is to have a larger coffee plantation. This is his first cycle with FAMA and he plans to invest the money very well so that he can pay his installments on time.

loans.use: to pay for labor, plant more coffee beans, and purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Jessenia Lucia

texts.es: Jessenia tiene 32 años y ha vivido en Guayaquil desde que nació. Entre risas no cuenta que no se ha casado porque aun no conoce a su príncipe azul. Vive con sus padres ya que su economía no le permite comprar una casa propia. El negocio lo aprendió de sus padres quienes se dedicaban a esta actividad, luego decidió independizarse con la venta de choclo y verde. Luego con la ayuda de sus hermanas empezaron la venta de humitas y bollos. Ahora tiene un pequeño bar con mucha clientela ya que sus productos gustan mucho. Jessenia nos informa que el sector no es peligroso pero existe la delincuencia la cual si le preocupa. Su meta futura es comprar su casa con un local para no tener que alquilar y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Jessenia, 32, has lived in Guayaquil since she was born.  Among laughter she relates that she’s still unmarried because she hasn’t yet met her Prince Charming.  She lives with her parents since her economy does not allow her to buy a house of her own.  

She learned the business from her parents since they were in that line of work and then she decided to become independent selling dehydrated potatoes and stuffed green banana balls.  Now she has a small snack bar with a large clientele since his products are very well-liked.  

Jessenia informs us that the sector isn’t too dangerous but there is some crime which does concern her.  Her future goal is to buy a house with an attached locale so that she doesn’t have to pay rent anymore and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and raw materials

loans.name: Sobeida Yanori

texts.es:
La joven Sobeida de 22 años de edad es soltera vive con una  tía  y no tiene hijos que depende de ella, su casa esta ubicada en una aldea al sur de Honduras.
 Se dedica desde hace 3 años al negocio de pulpería en donde vende azúcar, frescos, jabón, lácteos, pollo, carnes, y verduras, y esta solicitando 20,000.00 lempiras para la compra de refrescos, verduras, granos básicos, jabón, manteca, etc.
Con las ganancias de su negocio pretende pagar sus estudios de la universidad ya que ella estudia los fines de semana en la universidad a distancia, gracias a el apoyo de esta de PRISMA a su negocio, ella podrá salir adelante, tanto en su negocio como en su vida.
 Sobeida sus sueños son graduarse de la universidad y en un futuro construir su propia casa.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2012
texts.en:
Sobeida, 22, is a young, single woman living with an aunt; she does not have any dependent children.  Her house is located in a village in south Honduras.

For the last three years she’s been working as a grocer; she sells sugar, frozen fruit treats, soap, dairy products, chicken, meat and vegetables.  She’s asking for a 20,000 lempira loan to buy soft-drinks, vegetables, basic grains, soap, lard, etc.

With profits from her store she can pay her university costs because she attends ‘university at a distance’ on weekends.  Thanks to this business support from PRISMA she will be able to move forward both personally and in her business.

Sobeida’s great dream is to graduate from university and in future build a house of her own.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – March, 2012

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Andranik

texts.en:
Andranik is 39 years old. He lives in Soflu village with his parents and brother. The family gets its main income from agriculture. They have cultivated potatoes and beans, and kept beehives and raised cattle for 15 years. 

Andranik wants to develop his farm by purchasing more cattle and beehives. He plans to use this loan for purchasing 5 heifers and 10 beehives. This will allow him to increase the income from agriculture and create the necessary basis for its further expansion.

loans.use: to pay for 5 heifers and 10 beehives.

loans.name: Matondo 2 Group

texts.en:
Rita, age 32, is a single mother with one 16-year-old daughter. She is representing the Matondo 2 loan group. Rita makes and sells bags and sells pharmaceutical products from a small boutique near her house. She has been in this businesses for four years and is requesting this loan to buy more bag-making materials such as yarn, plastic cord and zippers. She will also use part of this loan to buy more medicines to stock in her boutique. Her business strategy is to advertise to the public and get the word out about her products. 

Rita has received two previous loans from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo, and has a very good repayment record. She wants to continue to expand her business and carry other products. She also hopes to start a small school to train girls and single mothers on how to make and sell bags. She will save some of the profits earned by her business to pay for her daughter's future studies.

loans.use: to pay for bag-making materials and pharmaceutical products.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Keo is a married woman who only finished her elementary education. Now she has been blessed with three children who are attending school. Presently she lives with her family in a suburban area about 17km from Phnom Phen city. She is engaged in cultivating rice on her existing farmland. Her husband works as a construction laborer around the country with his team. She has been in her business for more than 12 years. She aims to provide a good education for her children so that they may find better employment than she, who is just involved in rice farming. 

Keo is now asking for a loan of USD 1,000 to buy an extra plot of land to increase her rice production. She has insufficient funds now, so she hopes this loan will be granted to her to improve her rice crop and their lives as well. Someday, she aims to uplift her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to increase her rice production.

loans.name: Jose Isabel

texts.es:
El señor José de 43 años de edad, es casado, vive con su esposa y sus hijos en su casa de habitación ubicada en una ladea al sur de Honduras.
Don José tiene su negocio de venta de carnes de cerdo y de res, también vende ropa nueva y plástico su venta es ambulante en los barrios y caseríos de su comunidad, Don José esta solicitando 20,000.00 lempiras para compra de ropa, carne de res y cerdo, con las ganancias del negocio desea seguir adelante y seguir invirtiendo en el negocio para que crezca y así tener mejores ingresos para mejorar su casa.
El sueño de Don José es que su familia se pueda superar cada día en todo lo que hacen y estar con ellos siempre.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2012
texts.en:
José, 43, is married living with his wife and children in his house located in a village in south Honduras.

José has a business selling beef and pork and he also sells new clothes and plastics.  He sells from place to place in the neighborhoods and settlements in his community.  José is asking for a 20,000 lempira loan to buy clothes, beef and pork.  With profits from the business he wants to continue forward and continue investing in the business so that it will grow and he will have better income to improve his house.

José’s dream is that his family is able to improve each day in everything they do and to be with them always.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – March, 2012

loans.use: to buy beef, pork and new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Reyna Milagro

texts.es:
La joven Reyna de 21 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus familiares en una  aldea al sur de honduras, ella tiene un hijo que depende de ella.
Posee un negocio de pulpería en su casa donde atiende a sus clientes y amigos que ha diario le visitan pues ahí vende carnes, lácteos, ropa, cosméticos, abarrotería, frescos, camarones, pescado etc. Solicita el préstamo para compra de camarones, carnes, maseca, refrescos, sandalias, café, azúcar y otros productos de consumo básico.
Reyna el préstamo lo invirtió en su negocio y con esto pretende tener más ganancias y así tener un a mejor vida con su hijo.
El sueño de Reyna para este año es que sus ventas sean buenas para poder seguir adelante con sus proyectos de mejora de vivienda.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2012
texts.en:
Young Reyna, 21, is single living with relatives in a village in south Honduras; she has a son who’s dependent ton her.

She has a grocery store at home where she tends to her customers and friends who visit daily because she sells meats, dairy products, clothes, cosmetics, groceries, blended fruit treats, shrimp, fish, etc.  She’s asking for the loan to buy shrimp, meats, Maseca [brand of corn flour] soft-drinks, sandals, coffee, sugar and other basic staple items.

Reyna invested the loan in her business and intends with this to earn higher profits to have a better life with her son.  Reyna’s dream for this year is that sales are good so that she can continue forward with her home improvement plans.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – March, 2012

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Sisak

texts.en: Sisak is a 26-year-old farmer. He lives with his parents. Sisak's father is the deputy director at the village school. His mother is a teacher at the same school. Sisak is involved in farming. He grows fruits, vegetables and flowers on his land and in his greenhouse. Sisak wants to change the soil in his greenhouse, as the soil is old and this affects the quality of the harvest. This will allow Sisak to improve the land cultivation and get a better and richer harvest, which means increased income for this young farmer.

loans.use: to pay for soil

loans.name: Milkah

texts.en:
Milkah is a resident of Murang’a in Central Kenya where she lives with her family of three children between the ages of four and six. She has been in farming for six years. She sells her produce, which include milk, coffee, and bananas, to the local market. Her farm is run with the help of one farmhand engaged on a permanent basis.

Milkah has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a water tank. She says this will reduce the cost of running the farm with water that is supplied by water vendors. She plans to install an irrigation system on her farm to supply water in all seasons.

She laments of fluctuation of market prices for farm produce.

loans.use: To buy a water tank

loans.name: La Paix 2 Group

texts.en:
Marcelline, age 43, is a widow with two children in school. She also cares and provides for her elderly mother. She owns a perfume shop, and has been in business for two years. Marcelline plans to use the loan to buy more perfumes, soaps, and milk to sell in her shop. Her business strategy is to offer competitive prices against other businesses in the market. 

Marcelline has received three previous loans from Kiva partner HOPE Congo. She has a very good repayment record. She wants to continue to expand her business. Marcelline hopes to be able to fund both of her children's college education.

loans.use: to pay for perfumes, soaps, and milk.

loans.name: Wilfred

texts.en:
Wilfred is 58 years old and married with seven children. The last three children are still in school. He has been in farming for over 30 years. His farm produces and sells mainly milk and poultry products to the local market.

Wilfred has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He hopes to meet his family's needs with ease, especially the education of his last three children, and to buy more land to add to his acreage under cultivation.

Wilfred says animal diseases and unreliable rains are the main challenges to his business.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Matondo 1 Group

texts.en: Aimee is 35 years old, married and has four children, all of whom are in school. She represents the Matondo 1 group and has earned a living for the last two years by making and selling beignets in a local market. She will use this loan to buy sacks of flour and sugar, oil and firewood. Her business strategy is to sell her beignets very early in the day, when demand is highest. Aimee has received two previous loans from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo, and has a good repayment record. Her dream is to one day open a cafeteria. As her business continues to grow,  she hopes to be able to buy a plot of land and build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour and sugar, oil, and firewood.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a farmer in Central Kenya and produces maize and pigs for the local markets. She is married and has four children, two of whom are still in school.

Joyce has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy piglets and construct a zero grazing unit for her dairy cows. She says she will use the farming income to educate her two children and feed her family.

Joyce mentions harsh weather conditions and insufficient funds as her major challenges.

loans.use: To buy piglets and to construct a zero grazing dairy unit

loans.name: Duo Chuasij Group

texts.es: Duo Chuasij. doña Vilma tiene 2 hijos y se dedica a la confeccion de tejidos tipicos a mano es por eso que esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la confeccion de tejidos tipicos ya que esta conciente de que le falta capital para trabajar es por eso que esta solicitando este credito espera que le puedan ayudar para que pueda seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
Vilma has two children and works making handmade traditional textiles.
That is why she is requesting this loan, so that she can purchase raw materials to make traditional textiles, because she realizes that she lacks the capital to work. That is why she is requesting this loan. She hopes she can get help for her business to continue.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make handmade traditional textiles.

loans.name: Gs Toya Group

texts.es:
La Señora Olga, es casada, ella vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica al comercio, su actividad principal es la venta de abarrotaría (pulpería) ella cuenta con 8 años de experiencia.
Doña Olga cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo y sus hijos, ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de productos como ser: azúcar, manteca, jabón, refrescos, carnes, papel higiénico, maíz, frijoles y otros productos de consumo para la buena atención de sus clientes,  Doña Olga ha salido adelante gracias a su negocio, ya que ha sido una de las principales  fuentes de ingresos, ella se a sabido ganar la clientela porque que su  manera de atenderlos es muy atenta, su negocio esta en un punto estratégico porque es una estación de buses de toda la zona y también esta en un lugar de mucho transito de personas, ya que es una zona muy comercial.
Doña Olga su sueño es que sus hijos se superen y que su negocio siga creciendo para darles un mejor vida a su familia
La Señora María,  se dedica al comercio su actividad principal es la venta de mercadería ventas ropa nueva de dama y caballero.
La Señora Karen se dedica al comercio y su actividad principal es la venta perfumes finos, cremas y otros cosméticos.
Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - Marzo 2012
texts.en:
Olga is married living with her husband and three children.  She’s a merchant.  Her main activity is a grocery store.  She has 8 years’ experience.

Olga has support from her husband and children.  She’s asking for the loan to buy such products as: sugar, lard, soap, soft-drink, meats, toilet paper, corn, beans and other basic staple items to provide good customer service.

Olga has gotten ahead thanks to her business since it’s been one of the main sources of income.  She’s known how to win over clientele because she treats them very kindly.  Her business is in a strategic spot because it’s at a bus station for the entire zone and it’s a place with lots of passersby since it’s a very commercial zone.  Olga’s dream is to see her children improve themselves and that her business continues growing to give her family a better life.

María is a merchant and her main activity is selling new clothes for women and men.

Karen is a merchant and her main activity is selling fine perfumes, creams and other cosmetics.

Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - March 2012

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma, a 35-year-old mother of two children aged four and one, has been farming for ten years and also runs a retail shop within the local market where she sells her produce of maize, beans, potatoes, bananas and milk.

Emma has made a first-time request for a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy piglets and a water tank. She says that an adequate water supply will enable her to cultivate a variety of products during both the rainy and dry seasons. She aspires to grow her retail shop into a wholesale business in the future.

Emma says a lack of capital and a poorly developed local market are among the leading challenges she faces in farming.

loans.use: to buy piglets and a water tank.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is aged seventy years and has been in farming for twenty-seven years with his farm currently producing and selling milk and horticultural products to the local market.

Joseph has requested a loan of 100,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a milling machine in the local market. He says he will install grain processing equipment for use in the local area and hopes to increase his income. This is his second loan with Juhudi after the first one of 60,000 KES which he used to set up an aggro-vet shop which has helped him in treating his dairy animals and generating income to meet family needs.

Joseph says sourcing for capital remains the major challenge to smallholder farmers in the area. He is grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for improving smallholder living.

loans.use: To buy and install a milling machine

loans.name: Nasitasia

texts.en:
Nasitasia is a resident of Kitale in Western Kenya where she farms and meets all of her family's needs through sales of her produce to the local market. She is 46 years old, married, and the mother of five children ranging in age from 22 to 4. She has been farming for six years.

Nasitasia has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says the acquisition will improve her milk output and enable her to educate her three children who are still in school. She also aspires to install a milling machine in the local market.

Nasitasia says animal diseases are the major challenge in farming.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Genaro

texts.en:
Genaro is a member of the group called La Colmena (Beehive), located in the city of Samana. This is his seventh loan, which he will use to improve his house. He has had his business for over five years, started from his savings.

After his last loan, which he invested in his business, Genaro realised the need to improve his home, and with his business profits he began this renovation. He now needs to construct the roof, for which he is requesting this loan to buy cement and other necessary materials. The other members of his group are recommending him for a housing loan to finish the house construction.

Esperanza Internacional runs a programme for their good clients who are reliable in paying back their loans, who have fulfilled the commitment to grow their business and who have shown fidelity in their groups. This allows them to take out a loan to improve the structure of their house at the same time as running their business and attending their group meetings.

Genaro, a married man with seven children, is a pastor in his community church; he is also a micro entrepreneur conducting miscellaneous product sales. Genaro thanks God, Esperanza Internacional and all of you for this opportunity. In his name and that of his family he thanks all of you for your support!

In the picture we can see Genaro and part of the construction.

loans.use: to buy cement and other construction materials for his roof.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is one of Esperanza International's entrepreneurs. She has been taking loans with Esperanza International since she started her business selling natural fruit juices in her house seven years ago, in one of the rural communities in the city of Samana.

She is one of the members in the group called Mujeres Unidas (united women) located in one of the rural villages in the city of Samana. She has invested her 12th loan in her business selling natural fruit juices. Now she is receiving her 13th loan to improve her housing, having shown herself to be a dedicated woman, paying well all her previous loans and expanding her business.

She is the mother of two children and she lives together with her husband in a simple home structure. They are working hard to change their home structure, and they decided to take a loan with Esperanza to start improving their house. With this loan they will buy concrete blocks, cement, and other building materials. They will make and fix some of their house walls. 

Esperanza International is running a program where most of their good clients -- those who have fulfilled the commitment to grow their businesses and have shown fidelity in their groups -- can take loans to improve their house structure, while running their businesses and attending to their group meetings.

Carmen thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: To buy concrete blocks, cement and other building materials

loans.name: Emigdonia

texts.es:
La señora Emigdonia vive en zona sur del país, junto con ella viven sus 2 hijas quienes le ayudan en sus compromisos. Su negocio se encuentra en un punto estratégico, donde la fluidez de personas es bastante, ya que se encuentra en la calle principal.
Doña Emigdonia el crédito lo necesita para la compra de maíz, leña, cal y una sartén de aluminio para preparar sus tortillas, para satisfacer las necesidades diarias de sus clientes. El impacto con el financiamiento, será que incrementaran sus ventas, ya que podrá comprar más producto a menor precio, y de esta manera satisfacer la demanda diaria de sus clientes.
Doña Emigdonia sus planes a futuro es comprar un molde para hacer tortillas y así generarse mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida, para ella y su familia.  

Choluteca Honduras – Marzo 2012
texts.en:
Emigdonia lives in the southern part of the country.  She lives with her 2 daughters, and they help her to pay the bills.  Her business is located in a strategic spot where a lot of people pass through, since it is on a main street.

Emigdonia needs a loan to buy corn, firewood, lime and an aluminum pan to make her tortillas and satisfy the daily needs of her customers.  With this loan, she will increase her sales, since she will be able to buy more products at a lower price, and in this way satisfy the daily demands of her customers.  

In the future, Emigdonia plans to buy a tortilla press.  This way she will generate a better income and have a better quality of life for herself and her family.

Choluteca Honduras -  March 2012

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, lime and an aluminum pan to make tortillas

loans.name: Yosimara

texts.en:
Yosimara is one of Esperanza Internacional's entrepreneurs. She is a married woman with a child. They live together with her husband in a simple home structure. She is working hard to change her home structure, and with her husband, they decided to take a loan with Esperanza to continue improving their house.

Yosimara has been taking loans with Esperanza Internacional since she started her business with her first loan with Esperanza Internacional almost six years ago. She is receiving her 11th loan and this one is to build a bathroom. She will add a room in her house where she will build the bathroom. Now it is in her backyard, a little far away. 

She is one of the members in the group called Paz y Fe (Peace and Faith) located in one of the rural villages in the city of Samana. With this loan she will buy concrete blocks, cement, a toilet, a sink and other building materials. Esperanza Internacional runs a program for their good clients who are reliable in paying back their loans, who have fulfilled the commitment to grow their business and who have shown fidelity in their groups. This allows them to take out a loan to improve the structure of their houses at the same time as running their businesses and attending their group meetings. Yosimara thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: To buy building materials to build a bathroom

loans.name: Alhayah Group

texts.en:
This group is called ALHAYAH. It consists of four members: Mriam, Sameera, Asil (male) and Momtaz, who is the leader of the group. There are three females and one male and they live in Aden, Yemen. They took a loan of 260,000 YER.

Momtaz is 32 years old. She is the second woman on the right in the photo. She is married woman and has five children. She has been selling fish for two years. She lives in Aden, Yemen and she started her business with limited capital as well as that provided by a previous AMB loan. She is a very caring & supportive woman. 

The loan is the main source for her business. So, she applied for a loan of 70,000 YER from AMB in order to buy fish from the sea and sell it at the market.

In the future, she hopes to open a store for her business to improve her family.

loans.use: to buy fish for her business

loans.name: Ruzan

texts.en:
Ruzan lives in Shaghat village with her family: her husband, two children and her parents-in-law. The main source of income for Ruzan's family is the farm, which they have been running for twelve years. They cultivate potatoes and beans, raise livestock and keep beehives. Through the years they have created the necessary conditions for successful development of the farm. 

Ruzan has applied for this loan to develop cattle breeding. With the requested amount she plans to purchase two cows and 1,5 tons of condensed forage for the cattle. This will allow Ruzan to increase the income from agriculture, which she plans to invest in further expansion of the farm.

loans.use: to buy two cows and forage.

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es:
Doña María vive en la zona sur de honduras, es una persona honrada y luchadora, dedicada a su negocio propio que es venta de perfumería fina , junto con ella vive su hija y su esposo quienes la respalda en su negocio.
Doña María se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 10 años en el lugar donde reside. su negocio lo hace de manera ambulante, ya que tiene mucha clientela en colegios, centros bancarios como también clientes en barrios y colonias de la ciudad, a los cuales les distribuye sus producto todas las semanas.
El crédito Doña María lo necesita para la comprar lociones, desodorante, cremas, shampoo, tintes, pantalones, camisetas, calzonetas, camisas. el impacto que espera con el crédito, es  incrementar sus ventas y así de esta manera satisfacer cada pedido que le hacen sus clientes,  y  generarse mejores ingresos para tener una vida mejor.
los planes a futuro de Doña María es crecer día a día en su negocio, como también hacer unos cuartos de alquiler para tener una mejor calidad de vida ella y su familia.
Choluteca, Honduras – Marzo del 2012
texts.en:
Maria lives in the southern part of Honduras.  She is an honest and hardworking person who has her own business selling fine perfumes.  She lives with her daughter and her husband, and they support her in her business.

Maria has been doing this work in the place where she lives for 10 years.  She sells from place to place, because she has a lot of customers in schools and banking centers, as well as customers in the various neighborhoods of the city.  She distributes her products every week.

Maria needs a loan to buy lotions, deodorants, creams, shampoo, hair coloring, pants, T-shirts, bathing suits and shirts.  With this loan, she hopes to increase her sales and fill every order made by her customers, allowing her to generate more income and have a better quality of life.

In the future, Maria plans to grow her business each day.  She also plans to build some rooms to rent out so that she could have a better quality of life with her family.

Choluteca, Honduras - March 2012

loans.use: to buy lotions, deodorants, creams, shampoo, hair coloring, pants, T-shirts, bathing suits and shirts for her business

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.en:
Ignacia is a member of the group called Progreso de Esperanza (Progress of Hope) group 1, located in the city of Samana. This is her eleventh loan, which she will use to improve her house. She has had her business for around five years. Since then she has paid back all her loans and expanded her business. After her last loan, which she invested in her business, she realized the need to improve her home.

This is the reason why she talked to other members of her group and they recommended her for a Housing loan to improve her home by building a bathroom and changing her roof. She will buy zinc and wood for the roof and cement, concrete block and other materials for the bathroom.

Esperanza Internacional runs a program for their good clients who are reliable in paying back their loans, who have fulfilled the commitment to grow their business and who have shown fidelity in their groups. This allows them to take out a loan to improve the structure of their house at the same time as running their business and attending their group meetings.

Ignacia is a single mother of seven children and she is running a fruit and vegetable stand, next to her house, where she also sells chicken. This small business had given Ignacia, enough income to provide for her children. She thanks God, Esperanza Internacional and all of you for this opportunity. In her name and that of her family she thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: To buy zinc and other building construction materials.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine is twenty-eight years old. She lives in Tskhuk village with her husband and little son. Armine is a maths teacher at the village school. Armine and her husband are involved in farming. They want to start cattle breeding, too, which is why Armine has applied for this loan. 

With the requested amount she plans to purchase fifteen young pigs and forage for them. Armine also plans to invest in cultivating land. She will purchase 400 kg of beech seeds and 10 bags of fertilizer. Armine plans to feed the pigs and sell the meat at the end of the year. She also expects a good harvest of beech, the sales of which will allow her to get additional income. This is important for the young couple to have stable source of income during the year.

loans.use: to pay for pigs, forage, beech seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Yerazik

texts.en:
Yerazik is forty-one years old. She lives in Ditak village with her family. Yerazik's husband is forty-six years old, he works at the furniture-making factory as a furniture-maker. Yerazik's elder son is nineteen and serves in the army at present. Her younger son is eighteen. Yerazik and her husband run a farm: they cultivate land and raise cattle.

Yerazik plans to increase the number of livestock. She also wants to process the land before starting its cultivation. With the help of this loan Yerazik will purchase two calves and fertilizer. This is important for Yerazik to have a successful agricultural year and provide stable income for her family.

loans.use: to pay for two calves and fertilizer.

loans.name: Antiga

texts.en:
Antiga is a fifty-six-year-old retailer from Yerevan. She rents a booth in one of the city markets, where she trades clothing. Antiga wants to refresh the clothing variety in her booth to meet her clients' demand for summer clothing. Thus she has applied for this loan to purchase clothing.
 
Antiga plans to open a new booth, and this loan will give her opportunity to make savings and invest for implementation of this goal. Antiga lives with her son. Stable development of the business is important for her to improve her living conditions and support her son and his future family.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Tehmine

texts.en:
Tehmine is twenty-three years old. She lives with her husband and two little babies. Tehmine works as an educator at the local kindergarden. In addition, she is also involved in agriculture with her husband. The couple raises cattle and cultivates land. Tehmine is planning to start the spring land cultivation of wheat, for which she needs fertilizer to process the land and fuel for the agricultural machine. 

This loan will help Tehmine to cultivate the land effectively and gather a good harvest. Tehmine will earn more income from the sales of wheat, which is important for her to ensure better quality of life for her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizier and fuel.

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es: El señor Eusebio tiene 66 años edad, es casado y padre de 11 hijos, 4 de ellos dependen de el y su esposa, el resto de los hijos trabajan en la agricultura. Su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, ellos residen en la comunidad de las cañitas, Juticalpa, Olancho. Es una familia humilde y de escasos recursos, pero muy trabajadora y honesta. Desde hace 30 años el se dedica a la siembra y venta de café, oficio que aprendió de su padre desde que era muy pequeño, en la actualidad se dedica a la siembra de maíz, frijoles y café. El préstamo que don Eusebio solicita lo necesita para invertirlo en la compra de abono, para sembrar más café y comprar cemento para mejorar el lugar de almacenamiento del café. Con la ayuda de este préstamo el podrá mejorar su finca, darle un mayor mantenimiento y así poder ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes.  Una de sus metas es hacer crecer su finca de café para tener más producción y así tener mayores ingresos que le ayuden al sostenimiento de su familia. Este es el primer crédito que don Eusebio solicita en FAMA y  espera cancelar sus cuotas de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Eusebio, age 66, is married and has 11 children.  Four of his children are dependent upon him and his wife, and the rest of the children work in agriculture.  His wife devotes herself to the household chores.  They live in the Las Cañitas community in Juticalpa, Olancho.  They are a humble family with scarce resources, but they are very hard-working and honest.

Eusebio has been growing and selling coffee for 30 years.  He learned to do this from his father when he was very young.  He currently grows corn, beans, and coffee.

Eusebio needs the loan he is requesting to buy fertilizer to plant more coffee.  He will also buy cement to improve the place where he stores the coffee.  With the help of this loan he will be able to improve his farm and provide better maintenance.  That way he will be able to offer his customers a better product.

One of his goals is to expand his coffee farm in order to have more production.  This way he will have greater income to help support his family.  This is the first loan that Eusebio has requested from FAMA.  He expects to make his payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and cement.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit lives in Kapan city with her husband and son. She works at one of the local schools as an accountant. Anahit's son works at one of the factories in Kapan. Anahit is also involved in beekeeping. She has been running this business for twelve years and now keeps ten beehives. 

Anahit has applied for this loan to develop her beekeeping. With the requested amount she will purchase new beehives. Anahit plans to gather and sell more honey, which will allow her to earn more income and invest so she can add even more beehives.

loans.use: to pay for beehives.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is fifty-one years old. She lives in Kapan city with her husband and son. Rita's son works at the local fire service as a fireman. The largest part of the family's income comes from cattle breeding. Rita's farm includes eleven cows. She makes cheese from their milk and sells in the city. 

Now Rita wants to increase the number of cattle to make and sell more cheese. She applied for this loan to purchase cows and forage to feed them. This will help Rita to earn more income, which is important for her so that she can finish the renovation of her house and ensure higher living standards for her family.

loans.use: to pay for cattle and forage.

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine is twenty-eight years old. She lives in Davit Bek village with her husband, her two little daughters and a son. The couple runs a farm, where they raise livestock. The main income comes from making and selling cheese in nearby Kapan city, which is the regional center. Currently the number of livestock in the farm is twenty-two.
 
Narine wants to increase the number of cattle to gather more milk. Thus she has applied for this loan to purchase cattle and necessary forage for them. This will allow Narine to continue the stable development of cattle breeding, which is vital for the young family to cover their raising daily costs and meet the children's needs.

loans.use: to pay for cattle and forage.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane is forty-four years old. She lives with her husband, daughter and two sons. The main source of income for the family is agriculture: cattle breeding and land cultivating. 

Gayane wants to start  cultivation of the land, for which she uses an agricultural machine. Unfortunately, the machine Gayane owns is old and needs to be repaired. Gayane also needs to purchase new wheels for the machine. Repairing the agricultural machine is very important in order for Gayane to be able to cultivate the land effectively and have good harvest for this year. The sales of harvest will provide financial stability for Gayane's family.

loans.use: to buy wheels and repair her agricultural machine.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Мавлуда добрая и трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать троих детей. С 2001 года она занимается выращиванием лука, арбуза, огурцов и ячменя. Она имеет 2,65 гектаров поливной земли. Обрабатывает эти земли и выращивает сельхозпродукты. В семье работают Мавлуда и её муж, и они оба стараются содержать свою семью в хороших условиях. Мавлуда хотела бы получить займ для покупки семян, горюче-смазочных материалов и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Mavluda is a kind and hard-working woman. She is married and a loving mother of three children. Since 2001, Mavluda has been cultivating onions, watermelons, cucumbers and barley. She owns 2.65 hectares of irrigated land, on which she grows her crops. Mavluda's husband also works, and together they try to create good living conditions for their family. Mavluda would like to obtain a loan to purchase seeds, fuel, lubricants, and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en:
Gevorg is a thirty-four-year-old entrepreneur from Jermuk town, Armenia. He runs a shop in the busy center of the town, where he trades clothing and shoes. Gevorg started his business seven years ago, and has successfully managed it, attracting large number of permanent clients. 

Now Gevorg wants to expand his business, for which he needs to purchase a new variety of men and women's trousers and shirts. Gevorg will increase the sales, which means additional income. The latter is important for Gevorg to improve his family's living conditions and ensure better future for them.

loans.use: to buy men and women's trousers and shirts to sell.

loans.name: Osama Group

texts.en:
This group is called “OSAMA.” The five members of the group are Warda, Aisha, Khadigh, Fatima and Fawzih. They are all females from Aden, Yemen.They are hard working and work in different businesses. They took a loan of 250,000 YER. Aisha’s is the leader of the group. She is 41 and married. She is the woman who holds the currency paper in the photo and she has three children. She has been selling clothes for over 10 years. She started her business by collecting money from the association.

She decided on this business because she says she wanted to find a way to improve her quality of life and that of her family and to offer her little children a good education. She applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB. She will use the loan to buy skirts, shirts, sport uniforms, scarves, etc.  to continue selling her articles of clothing.

Her dream is to expand her locale a bit more to have it better stocked with articles of clothing and continue with her sales this way. In this way, she will obtain more and better income to continue supporting her children in their studies so that they can have good professional careers.

loans.use: to buy skirts, shirts; sport uniforms, scarves, etc for her business

loans.name: Halima

texts.ru: Халима замужем и любящая мать троих детей. Более 10 лет он занимается выращиваем выращиванием сельхозпродуктов. Имеет 2,55 гектар земли и выращивает лук, ячмень, пшеницу и помидора. Её муж помогает ей в бизнесе. Халима хотела бы получить займ для покупки семян, минеральных удобрений и горюче-смазочных материалов. Халима надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en: Halima is married and a loving mother of three children. For over 10 years, she has been cultivating crops. She owns 2.55 hectares of land where she grows onions, barley, wheat and tomatoes. Her husband helps with the business. Halima would like to obtain a loan to purchase seeds, mineral fertilizers, and petroleum products. She hopes for your help and compassion.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Tura

texts.ru: Тура женат и на воспитании имеет троих детей. Более 15 лет он занимается выращиванием сельхозпродуктов. Жена занимается домохозяйством. Имеет 2,3 гектар земли и выращивает ячмень, лук и арбузы. В семье работает один и содержит свою семью. Тура хотел бы получить займ для покупки горюче-смазочных материалов, семян и минеральных удобрений. Тура надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Tura is married and is raising three children. For over 15 years, he has been cultivating crops. He has 2.3 hectares of land where he grows barley, onions and watermelons. Tura's wife takes care of the household, while he is the only one who earns an income to support his family. Tura would like to obtain a loan to purchase petroleum products, seeds, and mineral fertilizers. He is hoping for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Jaime Leonel

texts.es: Don Jaime es un señor de la comunidad de las cañitas, cuya actividad principal es la caficultura, tiene 30 años de edad, es casado y padre de una hija y su esposa es ama de casa. El aprendió a cultivar café porque su padre le enseño desde que era un niño, negocio al cual se dedica desde 6 años de forma independiente, el horario de trabajo es de 6:00 am hasta las 2:00 pm. Una de las ventajas es que el café esta a buen precio y que el producto lo van a traer hasta su casa de habitación. Los inconvenientes que presenta es que las lluvias ocasionan la caída del café y no encuentra corteros ya que cuando es temporada de corte hay escasa mano de obra para poder recolectar el café de la finca. El préstamo  que don Jaime solicita lo necesita para comprar abono y poder chapear la tierra, para dejarla en mejores condiciones cuando sea la cosecha del café. Uno de los sueños de don Eusebio es tener más producción de café y hacer crecer mas la finca. Este es el segundo crédito que solicita en FAMA y hasta el momento ha cancelado sus cuotas de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Jaime lives in the community of Las Cañitas, where he makes a living in the cultivation of coffee. He is 30 years old, and is married with one daughter. His wife is a housewife. He learned how to cultivate coffee from his father from the time he was a small child. He has had his own independent business for the last 6 years. Ha works from 6 a.m. until 2 p.m. The advantages are that coffee is sold for a good price and the product is brought to his home where he lives. The inconveniences he faces are that the rain sometimes causes coffee to fall from the plants and it is sometimes difficult to find people to help pick the coffee during harvest time because labor is scarce.  

The loan that Jaime has requested he needs to buy fertilizer and to be able to till the land so that it is in prime condition for the coffee harvest. One of Jamie's dreams is to have a higher production of coffee and increase the size of his farm land. This is the second loan that he has requested through FAMA. In the past he has made his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy organic and chemical fertilizers and to till his land.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a thirty-four-year-old man, he is married and a father of two sons and two daughters. He has been a taxi driver for the past three years, and this is the only source of income to the family.

Ahmad wants to make some repairs to his taxi so it will become more efficient on the road. Therefore he is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of repairing and improving the taxi's condition such as: painting, changing lights and mirrors, changing tires. This will increase the taxi's efficiency and enable Ahmad to work extra hours and improve the family's income. 

Ahmad is photographed next to his taxi.

loans.use: To repair his taxi.

loans.name: Arcadia

texts.es:
La señora Arcadia tiene 62 años de edad, es casada y tiene cinco hijos. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora, vive junto a su esposo y una nieta. Ella se dedica a la venta de lácteos desde hace 40 años, esta actividad la aprendió de su esposo y él lo heredo de sus padres. Ellos han identificado que este rubro les deja un buen margen de ganancias, ya que las ventas en la localidad son buenas. A pesar de eso ellos desean incrementar ese margen de ganancias, ya que no pueden comprar como antes debido a que no cuentan con el dinero para hacerlo.

Ella compra los productos en los cantones cercanos al lugar donde vive a distintas personas, pero como el precio de venta no es el mismo, ella tiene que comprar así y después venderlo a un precio considerable en el cual ella no pierda a la hora de venderlo. Para comprar  sus lácteos, ella camina a pie a la casa  de los vendedores, puesto que en ese lugar no hay transporte público, a veces tiene que caminar kilómetros para llegar a sus casas y luego lo traslada cargándolo ella misma.

El préstamo será invertido en la compra de más cantidad de queso, guajada y crema. Actualmente solo puede comprar 75 libras de queso, 30 libras de guajada y 50 botellas de crema por semana y Arcadia quiere comprar el doble de cada producto, porque tiene mucha clientela y no ajusta a surtir por falta de dinero. Con la inversión ella mejorara su ingreso económico y las ventas aumentaran  ya que la clientela quedara satisfecha porque siempre encontraran el producto fresco en su casa.

Arcadia desea tener una mejor calidad de vida, con la venta de los productos lácteos, para cubrir con todos los gastos en su hogar ayudando a su esposo, debido a que los dos están en una edad avanzada, pero aun tienen el espíritu luchador para seguir trabajando ya que los trabajos agrícolas son muy pesados, por eso la venta de lácteos le es más fácil y también porque cuentan con la ayuda de la alcaldía municipal que le ha proporcionado un local donde ellos puedan vendar sus  productos.
texts.en:
Arcadia is 62 years old. She is married and has five children. She is a very hard-working and determined person. She lives together with her husband and one granddaughter. She has worked for 40 years selling dairy products. She learned this work from her husband, and he inherited it from his parents. They have discovered that this kind of work gives them a good profit margin, since sales are good in their area. In spite of this, they would like to increase this profit margin; they cannot buy as much as before, since they don't have the money to do so. 

She buys the products in the districts close to the place where she lives, from various people. However, since the sale price is not the same, she has to buy in this way and later sell as a considerable price so she will not make a loss at the time of the sale. To buy her dairy products, she goes on foot to the vendors, since there is no public transportation in this place. At time she has to walk for kilometers to reach their homes, and later she comes back carrying the products herself. 

The loan will be invested in buying greater quantities of cheese, curds and cream. Currently, she can only buy 75 pounds of cheese, 30 pounds of curds and 50 bottles of cream per week, and Arcadia would like to buy the double amount of each product, because she has a lot of customers and she is not able to stock up because of a lack of funds. With this investment, she will improve her income and her sales will increase, because her customers will be satisfied since they will always find fresh products at her home. 

Arcadia wants to have a better quality of life, with the sale of dairy products to help her husband cover all of the expenses of their household. Both are at an advanced age, but they still have a determined spirit to keep working. Because agricultural work is very heavy, the sale of dairy products is easier for her, and they also benefit from the help of the municipal authorities, who have given them a shop where they can sell their products.

loans.use: to buy larger quantities of cheese, curds and cream.

loans.name: Kenjeke

texts.ru:
Кенжеке 54 года, замужем, воспитала 2 детей. В качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, Кенжеке с 2005 года занимается животноводством. В хозяйстве Кенжеке на сегодняшний  день имеется 6 коров, 1 лошадь и 40 овец. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кенжеке обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку бычков для откорма и перепродажи.  Доходы от кредита Кенжеке планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Kenjeke is 54 years old, married, and has raised 2 children. She has been raising livestock since 2005, thereby providing the main source of income for her family. Presently, her farm has 6 cows, 1 horse, and 40 sheep. In order to continue developing her business, Kenjeke has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy calves for fattening and resale. Kenjeke plans to invest her profits from this loan into further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Esperanza De Pasacoguin 1 Group

texts.es:
La señora Lucia esta casada, tiene 29 años de edad, cursó los 3 años de educacion primaria, tiene 2 hijos los cuales aun no estudian, se dedica al comercio a la venta de ropa para todas las edad, inicio este negocio con poco capital y hasta el momento lleva 5 años de experiencia, cuenta con el poyo de su esposo quien se dedica al mismo trabajo.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo nque lo utilizara para la compra de mercadería, y de esa forma incrementar sus ventas, ya que en el futuro quiere tener un capital amplio. Las demás integrantes se dedica a la artesanía, al comercio y a la agropecuaria.
texts.en:
Lucia is 29 years old, married, and studied three years of her 'educación primaria' (schooling for children aged 7-14).  She has two children who are not in school yet.  Lucia's business is selling clothing for all ages.  She started this business with a small amount of capital and she currently has 5 years' experience.  She has the support of her husband who is in the same line of work.

Lucia got together a group to request a loan that she will use to buy merchandise.  This will increase her sales.  In the future, she would like to have more capital.  The other members of this group make handicrafts, sell products and work in agriculture.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell

loans.name: Felicito

texts.es:
El  señor Felicito tiene 47 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos. Él se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería desde que era un niño, inicio trabajando bajo las ordenes de su papá, cuando él falleció Felicito tomo el mando de los trabajos para sacar adelante a su mamá y hermanos. Luego él formo su propia familia, pero ya les había enseñado a trabajar a sus hermanos menores.

El compra los insumos para su trabajo de agricultor en el pueblo más cercano que esta a un kilómetro de su casa, pero los tiene que trasladar hasta el lugar donde tiene sus cultivos que esta a diez kilómetros de el centro de la ciudad y como el transporte es escaso él tiene que pagar a un vehiculo para que los traslade hasta donde están los cultivos.  

El préstamo será invertido en la compra de abono, venenos, plaguicidas para sus cultivos de maíz, fríjol y maicillo, también comprara concentrados, vitaminas y desparacitantes para su ganado, además reparara los cercos en los potreros, para que su ganado pueda pastar sin problemas que entren otros o que se salga su ganado. 

Con la inversión realizara todos sus proyectos en un corto tiempo, ya que con el préstamo contratara a personas para que le ayuden y así terminar más rápido, al mismo tiempo que le ayudara a esaS personas con el dinero que les pague. 

Felicito desea comprar el terreno donde cultiva, comprar más ganado para su cuido y comprar un carro para ya no depender de terceras personas para que le ayuden en el traslado de sus insumos.
texts.en:
Felicito is 47 years old, married, and has three children.  His business is farming and raising livestock.  He has been in this line of work since he was a child.  He started out working under his father's instructions.  When his father died, Felicito took over the work so that he could provide for his mom and siblings.  He then formed his own family but had already taught his younger siblings to work by this point.

Felicito buys the supplies he needs for his agricultural work in the nearest village which is one kilometer from his home.  However, he then has to transport them to the place where he grows his crops which is 10 kilometers from the town center.  As transportation is scarce, he has to pay for a vehicle to transport his supplies to the place where he grows his crops.

Felicito will invest his loan in buying fertilizers, weedkillers and pesticides for his corn, bean and sorghum crops.  He will also buy concentrated feed, vitamins and antiparasitics for his cattle.  In addition, he will fix the fences around his fields so that his cattle can graze without the problem of other animals getting in or his animals getting out.

As a result of this investment, Felicito will be able to carry out all his projects in a short space of time.  He will use the loan to hire people to help him so that he can finish his work more quickly.  He will be helping these people with the money that he pays them.

Felicito would like to buy the plot of land where he grows his crops, buy more cattle to care for and also buy a car so that he no longer has to depend on third parties to help him transport his supplies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, weedkillers and pesticides for his corn, bean and sorghum crops.  He will also buy concentrated feed, vitamins and antiparasitics for his cattle, and fix the fences around his fields

loans.name: Yaseen

texts.en:
Yaseen is a thirty-five-year-old man, he is married with three sons and two daughters. 

For the past four years, Yaseen has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income for the family, but also not enough to cover all the family's costs and needs.

Yaseen is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of  insuring and licensing the taxi. This will make the taxi legal to move from one area to another and will enable Yaseen to take more clients from his area and other areas. This will improve the family's income.

Yaseen is photographed next to his taxi.

loans.use: To pay for insuring and licensing the taxi.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is a farmer in the Kitale area of Western Kenya and has been in farming for four years. His farm currently produces and sells maize and beans which are sold locally. He generates additional income from a motorcycle transport business.

Samwel has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds. He says this will improve his farming income, make him financially secure and help him establish a strong foundation for his future family. He hopes to venture into dairy farming as well.

He mentions capital as the major challenge in farming especially for smallholder farmers.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Precilla

texts.en:
Precilla is from the village of Villaluz. She is forty-nine years old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Precilla owns a transportation business providing motorcycle transport to local members of the community. Precilla has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Precilla joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 13,000 PHP to maintain the vehicle used in the business.

loans.use: to maintain a transport vehicle used in the business.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de 6 femmes mariées, les membres de groupe Danaya vivent majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles avec une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans la ville de Sikasso (3ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et de mariage. 
Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce, de savons, beurres de karité, d’ignames, gingembre et des gâteaux à base de farine de blé. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégrés  Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Yassa (assise à droite sur la photo) est la vendeuse de la farine de blé du groupe. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2 sacs de farine + 1sac de sucre + 1bidon de 5 litres d’huile et 1 petit carton de bicarbonate. 
Elle s’approvisionne auprès des grossistes et effectue ses  ventes en détail, au comptant, à domicile et au marché, à une clientèle composée d’enfants et de femmes. 
Madame Yassa compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 23.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et aider son mari dans  certaines dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The Danaya group is composed of six married women living mainly in traditional families and averaging 41 years of age, with four children. They all live in the town of Sikasso (the third administrative Region of Mali) and know each other as relatives and neighbors.

The group members sell soap, shea butter, yams, ginger, and cakes made of wheat flour.
With the goal of bolstering their working capital, the group members have joined Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their 3rd solidarity loan.
Mrs. Yassa (seated on the right in the photo) is the group member who sells wheat flour. She plans to use her loan to buy two bags of flour, one bag of sugar, one five-liter jug of vegetable oil and one small box of baking soda.

She buys from wholesalers and sells retail, for cash, out of her home or at the market place, to a customer base composed of women and children.
With this loan, Mrs. Yassa plans to achieve an average monthly revenue of 23,000 West African Francs, which will be used to reinvest in the business and help her husband with some family expenses.

loans.use: to buy baking ingredients

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is from the village of Villaluz. She is sixty years old and married with three adult children. To make a living, Rosalina operates a motorcycle transportation business. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2,300 PHP a month. 

Rosalina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to maintain the vehicle used in her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to maintain the vehicle used in her transportation business.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda, forty-four, lives in a rural area of Barangay Cabisera 14-16 province of Isabela. Married to Rodolfo, who works as the driver of a passenger jeep and who maintains their farming business, they are blessed with a happy family life. They hope to provide all six of their children, who range in age from sixteen to one, with quality educations. 

Merlinda is requesting 20,000 PHP a loan for her mini-grocery store to purchase additional supplies of items such as sugar, coffee, milk, detergent and fragrant soap, rice, soft drinks, bottled and canned goods, etc. to satisfy her customers' needs. Her main purpose in seeking to improve the business is to better help her husband sustain the education of their children.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her store.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a resident and a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya. She has been in active farming for six years. Her farm produces milk, maize, beans and sorghum for the local market. She is married with three children aged between twenty-three and fourteen years.

Gladys has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds for a venture into poultry farming. She says this will boost her farming income and she reiterates she will use the income to improve her family living standards. She is also focusing on expanding her dairy farming as well.

Gladys says the challenges in farming are fluctuations in market prices and animal diseases.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: José Pio

texts.es:
El  señor José tiene 51 años de edad, es soltero. Él se dedica a la agricultura, fueron sus padres quienes le enseñaron ese trabajo. Él siempre deja la semilla de la cosecha anterior y lo demás lo compra en una ciudad del oriente del país. 

El préstamo será invertido en la compra de insumos para sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz. Con la inversión podrá trabajar en la tierra, además tendrá programado el consumo para la siguiente época de siembra. Una parte de la cosecha la venderá para mejorar sus ingresos y la otra la guardara para su consumo. José desea sembrar hortalizas como pipían y sandia.
texts.en:
José is 51 years old and single.  He is a farmer; his parents taught him this work.  He always leaves the seeds of the previous harvest, and he buys the rest in a city in the eastern part of the country.

He will use the loan to plant 7,000 square meters of corn.  With this investment he will be able to work the land.  He will also have consumption planned for the next planting season.  He will sell one part of the harvest in order to improve his income.  He will save the other part for his consumption.

José wishes to plant vegetables and fruit like squash and watermelon.

loans.use: to buy supplies to plant 7,000 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Badr

texts.en:
Badr is 30 years old, married and has five children who live together in Taiz, Yemen. He has always been characterized by being a person who very much wants to get ahead and this has allowed him to overcome the great diversities life has presented him. 

He has been operating a grocery store for six years. At first, his father provided him with capital and then he went ahead and bought land, opened a gas cylinder store and bought a truck. He’s currently in a store selling all kinds of basic grocery items. 

Aiming at increasing the variety of products he offers his customers, Badr is looking for a loan of 250,000 YER from AMB. This will give him the possibility of buying basic staple items such as soft drinks, sugar, mineral waters and canned food to offer greater variety to his customers. He would like to expand his business and build a house.

In this way, he hopes his business will grow and consolidate within the sector and that his customers will find good service and a wide variety of products in his store. Badr hopes his store will generate higher income so that he can offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic staple items such as soft drinks, sugar, mineral waters and canned food for his business

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 46 years old and married to Santi, who is a farmer. They are blessed with two children, who are Roshellin – 29 years old and a commerce graduate, and Caren Joy – 20 years old and currently a high school freshman. With a good relationship in the family, Merlita is really inspired in pursuing the business she started because she wants to finance her youngest daughter's college education. They live in the Ilagan municipality. Merlita shared also that the village where they live is a faraway rural place and mountainous.

Merlita wants to request loan assistance for her rice vending business, amounting to PHP 35,000, that will be very helpful to her business. According to her, the loan will be used to purchase sacks of rice and animal feed for her business since they are in demand.
