*Virginia es la 4ta (derecha) viste polo fuccia.
texts.en:
"Path to Success" is a group formed by six members, one of them is Virginia who is the president of the group. She is a hard working woman and for 21 years she has dedicated herself to business. First, she began selling vegetables, but due to the hardship that it brought, she decided to leave that and change to the category of groceries. In her business she offers her clients many types of beans, noodles and diverse bread products to carry out. With the fruit of this labor she completed the purchase of the stall that she rented before, and today she owns it and another one where her daughter works. Her work has permitted her to do many things; the items she thinks are the most important are giving her three children a good education and the improvement of her home. In the future she wants to move her business to her house and to convert it into a wholesale grocery. With her loan she will buy different products like rice, sugar and noodles, this way she will offer a variety to keep her clients content.

Virginia is the fourth (on the right) wearing a pink polo.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and noodle products.

loans.name: Glal

texts.en:
Glal is a single man who lives in the city of Sana`a,Yemen. 

He is involved in sales. He leases a space where he opened a phone accessories business. He started his business with small capital but he intends to expand his business.

He is requesting this loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to buy phones and phone recharging equipment, etc., to increase his capital.

loans.use: to buy phones and phone accessories for his business.

loans.name: Mimosette

texts.fr: Mimosette est une jeune femme agée de 29 ans marié, mère de trois enfants dont l'age varie entre 2 et 10 ans. deux de ses enfants vont déjà à l'école. Elle commerçante dans un marché de la place ou elle vend les vivres frais, légumes et condiments en fonction des saisons depuis 6 ans déjà. Elle mène à bien son activité mais ne peut que vendre en détails à cause de ses moyens limités. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour s'acheter plus de marchandises, elle veux acheter  en gros chaque week end pour éviter les déplacements en semaine  pour pouvoir dimuniuer ses frais de transport. ce qui lui permettra de revendre en gros à certains  d'augmenter son profit qui l'aidera à économiser pour les rentrées scolaires prochaines de ses enfants et agrandir son activité dans le futur.
texts.en: Mimosette is a young woman of 29 years. She is married and mother of three children, aged between 2 and 10 years. Two of her children already go to school. She is a storekeeper in a market on the square where she has sold fresh food, vegetables and spices according to the seasons for six years already. She carries her business through but can only sell retail because of her limited means. She is asking for this loan in order to buy additional merchandise. She wants to buy in bulk each weekend in order to avoid making trips during the week in order to reduce her transportation costs. This will let her resell in bulk to certain customers, and to increase her profit, which will help her to save up for her children's next next back-to-school expenses and to grow her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy in bulk.

loans.name: Younunyam

texts.fr:
Younunyam est une femme âgé(e) de 52 ans. Elle est mariée à un retraité et ont ensemble 06 enfants.  Seul 01 est scolarisé. Le premier a 33ans et le dernier 23ans.
Younunyam travaille comme revendeuse de céréales et charbons de bois depuis 1998. Elle vend à la maison à ses clients et est aidée par 02 personnes.
Younunyam a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des céréales et des sacs de charbons de bois. Elle veut agrandir l’activité, diversifier les produits et assurer les besoins élémentaires de la famille.
texts.en:
Younunyam is a 52 year old woman. She is married to a retiree and they have six children together. Only one is in school. The first is 33 years old and the youngest is 23. 
Younunyam has worked as a reseller of grains and charcoal since 1998. She sells at the house to her customers and is helped by two people. 
Younunyam requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy grains and bags of charcoal. She wants to grow her business, diversify her products and provide for the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy grains and bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Gs Djk Group

texts.es:
La Señora Denia, se dedica al comercio, su actividad principal es la venta de abarroteria (pulpería) ella cuenta con 5 años de experiencia. Su negocio es conocido como pulpería “Bendición de Dios” Doña Denia cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, tiene 3 hijos, y solicita el préstamo para la compra de productos como ser: azúcar, manteca, jabón, refrescos, carnes, papel higiénico maíz frijoles y otros productos de consumo para la atención de sus clientes,  ella a través de su negocio a salido adelante, ya que ha sido una de las principales  fuentes de ingresos, ella se a sabido ganar la clientela porque que su  manera de atenderlos es muy especial, su negocio esta cerca de un campo de fútbol y además es una de las pocas pulperías de la zona, Doña Denia tiene que levantarse muy temprano a atender a sus clientes porque en esos lugares las personas acostumbran a levantarse temprano, Doña Denia por su responsabilidad es la líder del Grupo Solidario DJK.
Doña Denia sueña con que sus hijos sean unas personas estudiadas y también le gustaría que su negocio creciera para darle una mejor vida a su familia.
La Señora Rufina su actividad principal es la venta de abarroteria pulpería.
La Señora Kenia, se dedica al comercio y su actividad principal es la venta de ropa de varón, camisas, faldas, ropa interior ropa de niño. 
Danli El Paraíso, Honduras Abril 2012
texts.en:
Denia is a shop owner. Her main business is selling groceries. She has five years of experience. Her business is known as “Bendición de Dios” grocery store. She receives help from her husband. Denia has three children. She is requesting the loan in order to purchase products like: sugar, butter, soap, soft drinks, meats, toilet paper, corn, beans and other products for the customers. Through her business, she can make progress. It has been one of her main sources of income. She is able to keep customers because her way of dealing with customers is very special. Her business is near a soccer field. In addition, it’s one of a few grocery stores in the area. Denia has to wake up very early to deal with her customers because in these places people are used to waking up early. Denia is the leader of the DJK communal bank. 
Denia dreams that her children will be studious people. Also, she would like her business to grow in order to give her family a better quality of life. 
Rufina’s main business is selling groceries. 
Kenia sells clothing including men’s clothing, shirts, skirts, underwear and children’s clothing.
Danli El Paraíso, Honduras April 2012

loans.use: purchase sugar, butter, soap, soft drinks, meats, toilet paper, corn, beans and other products for the customers.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: Francisco , es originario de León, de oficio mecánico automotriz. El utilizo su primer préstamo Kiva para la compra de un  compresor y unas herramientas para reparar autos, gracias al apoyo de los prestamistas de KIVA, logro comprar esa herramienta que ha sido de mucha utilidad y provecho para su negocio y sobre todo para darle una mejor atención a sus clientes.  Ahora requiere este crédito para  comprar otras herramientas tales como llaves, desarmadores, tuercas , rines , soplete para soldadura, pinturas para carro. Pues son parte de los materiales que utiliza para dar un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en: Francisco is from León and is a professional auto mechanic. He used his first Kiva loan to buy a compressor and some tools to repair cars. Thanks to the support of the Kiva lenders, he was able to buy this tool that has been very useful and profitable for his business and above all, he can give better service to his customers. Now he requests this loan to buy other tools like keys, screwdrivers, nuts, wheels, a welding torch and paints for cars because these are part of the materials that he uses to give good service to his customers.

loans.use: to buy other tools like keys, screwdrivers, nuts, wheels, a welding torch, and paints for cars.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a 34-year-old man who deals in secondhand shoes, a  business which he has run for a period of 9 years. He started by selling bananas, and after accumulating enough income he ventured into the shoes business. He says inadequate capital and high taxes are affecting the business. Ibrahim would like to buy a car, expand his business to new markets and buy land for growing crops. Ibrahim wants a loan to buy shoes for sale.

loans.use: to buy shoes for sale.

loans.name: Jóvenes Camino Al Progreso Group

texts.es:
Marina es una madre muy joven tiene  22 años, si hay algo que la caracteriza son sus ganas de trabajar;  tanto ella como sus hermanas siempre se han dedicado a la venta de alimentos. Marina pudo ahorrar algo de dinero para comprar su carrito sanguchero, ella trabaja vendiendo todo tipo de comidas como salchipapas, alitas, pollo bostear y hamburguesas, a su negocio le puso el nombre de su hijo “HAMBURGUESAS AHREN” es muy conocida en el lugar y gracias a su buena sazón tiene muchos clientes mayormente trabajadores de la zona, el negocio de Marina  le ha permitido darle a su hijo una mejor educación también comprar algunos artefactos para su casa, lo que más quisiera es comprarse una casa propia  y poner un restaurante para trabajar con sus hermanas, con el dinero de su préstamo comprara  embutidos y descartables, productos necesarios para su negocio. Marina es la tesorera del grupo “JOVENES CAMINO AL PROGRESO”. 

*Marina viste de color turquesa.
texts.en:
Marina is a young mother. She is 22 years old and if there is something that characterizes her, it is her desire to work. She, as well as her sisters, have always worked selling food. Marina was able to save some money to buy her sandwich cart and she works selling all kinds of foods like salchipapas (potatoes with sausage), wings, chicken, and hamburgers. She named her business Hamburgers-Ahren after her son. She is well-known in her area and, thanks to the good flavor she has, she has many customers, many of whom work in the area. Marina's business has allowed her to give her son a better education and also buy some things for her house. She would like to buy her own house and start a restaurant where she could work with her sisters. With the loan money she will buy meat and disposable dishes that she needs for her business. Marina is the treasurer in the Jovenes Caminos al Progeso (Young People Progressing) Group.

*Marina is wearing turquoise.

loans.use: buy meat and disposable dishes

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 22 year old gentleman living in Kagadi,Uganda. He has a retail shop which he has run for a period of 1 year. He started in agriculture and then got capital and started a retail business. He says inadequate capital is affecting the business. Joseph would like to build a permanent home and expand his business to new markets. He wants a loan to buy sugar and salt for sale.

loans.use: to buy sugar and salt for sale.

loans.name: Mirando Al Éxito Group

texts.es: La Sra. Mirsa de 47 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 2 aún dependen de ella. Tiene 6 meses con Edaprospo y se dedica a la venta de productos naturales “Herbalyfe”, con el cual lleva 4 años en este negocio. Comenzó con la idea de mejorar el estilo de vida de su familia. Con su esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado elevar la calidad de vida de toda su familia. Actualmente su ingreso lo destina a cubrir los gastos de agua y luz, ya que su esposo cubre los gastos de alimentación y educación. Su plan para el futuro es llegar a ser la presidenta del grupo “Herbalyfe”. Ella usó el crédito en la compra de más productos naturales para su negocio. Mirsa pertenece a la alcancía comunal “Mirando al Éxito”, nombre que pusieron por el gran objetivo que tiene el grupo el cual es “progresar en la vida”, y esta conformado por 7 socias. Mirsa lleva el cargo de presidenta desde que se formó el grupo.
texts.en: Mirsa, 47, lives with a partner and has 4 children, 2 of whom are still dependent upon her.  She has been with Edaprospo for 6 months, and she has had a business selling natural Herbalife" products for 4 years.  She started this business with the idea of improving her family's living standards.  With her effort and hard work, she has managed to improve her family's quality of life. Now her business covers her household's water and electricity bills, because her husband pays for the food and educational expenses.  In the future, Mirsa plans to become the president of the "Herbalife" group.  She will use this loan to buy more natural products for her business.  Mirsa belongs to the communal bank "Mirando al Exito" (Looking toward Success),  a name that this group decided upon because their main objective as a group is to make progress in life.  This group has 7 members.  Mirsa has been the president since the group was formed.

loans.use: to buy natural products for her business

loans.name: Purito Norte Group

texts.es: La Sra. Liz de 31 años de edad, es casada y tiene 1 hijo el cual aún depende de ella. Tiene 2 años con Edaprospo y se dedica a la venta de cuadros decorativos desde hace 12 años. Empezó con una cantidad mínima de mercadería el cual fue aumentando con el transcurrir de los años. Con su esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado aperturar 4 puestos mas en un mercado muy conocido y también logró comprarse un auto. Actualmente su ingreso lo destina en la educación de su hijo, mientras que su esposo cubre los gastos de alimentación y vestimenta. Su plan para el futuro es seguir creciendo con su negocio y comprarse una casa. Ella usó el crédito en la compra de mercadería para su negocio. Liz pertenece a la alcancía comunal “Purito Norte”, el cual esta conformado por 7 personas y lleva el cargo de presidenta desde hace 1 año.
texts.en: Ms. Liz is 31 years old, is married and she has one son who is dependent on her. She has spent two years with Edaprospo and she has dedicated herself to the sale of decorative tables for 12 years. She began with a small quantity of merchandise which was increased over the passing of several years. With her strength and work she has completed opening four more stalls in a very well known market and she also completed the purchase of a car. Currently her earnings are destined for the education of her son, while her husband covers the expenses for food and clothes. Her plan for the future is to continue growing her business and to buy a house. She will use the loan to buy merchandise for her business. Liz belongs to the community group "Purito Norte" which is composed of 7 persons and she has held the position of president for one year.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Jeanine

texts.en:
Jeanine is 34 years old and married. She sells various goods such as sugar, tomatoes, salt, soap, lotions, etc., and has been in this business for one year. Her business is open from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. each week, and she currently employs one person to help her. 

Jeanine has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods such as sugar, tomatoes, salt, soap, lotions, etc., to sell.  With any profits, she will be able to save for her future and will be able to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase various goods such as sugar, tomatoes, salt, soap, lotions, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en: Amos is a thirty eight year old married man with three children living in Kasese,Uganda. He has been teaching for fourteen years. His hardship is lack of enough salary. His personal goals are educating his children and further education for himself. Amos wants a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Ammar

texts.en:
Ammar is a man who dedicates his work to selling groceries, spices and vegetables. He has managed to get ahead in life with his 2 children. He started his business with his smaller business and as well as making sandwiches for student where his store is located and that with strength, they can constantly progress. 

He has experienced many difficult moments. He has been able to protect his children and earn the income that he needed to cover daily necessities.

Currently, he has applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to be able to buy canned food, oil, tomatoes, onions, and spices, among other things. These products are what his customers purchase and they will be happy if they can find everything they need in the same store.

loans.use: to buy canned food, oil, tomatoes, onions, and spices, among other things

loans.name: Halal

texts.en: Halal is 27 years old and lives in Sana'a, Yemen. He has a grocery store that sells grocery items. He has had this business for 3 years. First, he opened a small food retail shop then he bought a car from his business profit.  He requested a loan of 100,000 YER to buy stocks of canned goods, soft drinks and biscuits. He hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, soft drinks and biscuits for his business

loans.name: Abass

texts.en: Abass is a 44-year-old, married man and has 6 children. They live in Taiz, Yemen. He bought a plot of land with limited capital and already built a house there which he leases. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 YER to buy more construction supplies for his business in order to increase his working capital. He is trying best he can to offer his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy more construction supplies for his business

loans.name: Luz Argentina

texts.es:
Luz, tiene 49 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus 6 hijos, en una Colonia de San Pedro Sula, 3 de sus hijos están estudiando.
Doña Luz, tiene tres años de generar sus propios ingresos para apoyar al hogar, ella vende mercadería como ser: Ropa de niños, blusas, camisas, pantalones, buzos, suéter, etc. Este negocio lo inicio con fondos propios y con ayuda del esposo. 
Su producto lo vende de forma ambulante y en casa,  por pedidos y entrega a domicilio. Para mantener surtido de producto está solicitando un préstamo por 5000.00 Lempiras, del cual comprara ropa de niños y adultos para su negocio.
Su plan es hacer crecer el negocio mediante préstamos y obtener los ingresos necesarios para darles un buen estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Luz, age 49, lives with her husband and their six children in a neighborhood in San Pedro Sula.  Three of her children go to school.

For three years Luz has been generating her own income in order to support her household.  She sells merchandise like children’s clothes, blouses, shirts, pants, sweatshirts, and sweaters, etc.  She started this business with her own funds and with her husband’s help.

She sells her products in an itinerant manner, at her house, and by orders, which she delivers to the customers’ homes.

In order to keep her product stocked she is requesting a loan for 5,000 lempiras.  She will use the loan to buy children’s and adults’ clothing for her business.

Her plan is to make her business grow through loans and to get enough income to give her children a good education.

loans.use: to buy children’s and adults’ clothing to sell.

loans.name: Santos Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Francisca de 33 años de edad, vive con su conyugue en su casa ubicada en una aldea en el sur de Honduras, ella radica ahí desde hace 15 años, tiene dos hijos quienes estudian y su esposo trabaja como albañil, Doña Francisca se dedica desde hace 4 años a la venta de frescos, churros, chamuscas, y también tiene maquinas para costura ya que es otra fuente de ingresos para su hogar.
Doña Francisca solicita 18,000.00 lempiras a PRISMA para seguir la reparación de su casa ya que le faltan las puertas ventanas y el pulido de algunas partes de la casa, con el créditos que prisma le ha dado ha mejorado su casa y esta muy contenta, su negocio le ayuda a pagar sus cuotas ya que la costura es una de la fuentes mas fuerte de sus ingresos.
Doña Francisca su sueño es que su negocio crezca y terminar de arreglar su casa, para darles una mejor vida a su familia.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2012
texts.en:
Sra. Francisca is 33 years old and lives with her husband in their home located in a neighborhood in southern Honduras. She moved there 15 years ago. Francisca has two children who are studying and her husband works as a bricklayer. For the past four years, Doña Francisca has been selling soft drinks, donuts, and bags of juice, but she also has sewing machines that she uses to earn additional income for her household.

Doña Francisca is requesting a loan of 18,000 HNL from PRISMA so that she can continue repairing her house, which lacks doors and windows. Some parts of her house also need to be polished. The loans from PRISMA have helped to improve her home, so she is very pleased. Her business enables her to repay her loans since sewing is one of her major sources of income. Doña Francisca dreams of growing her business and finishing the renovations to her house so that she can provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy doors and windows and to pay to have parts of her house polished.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her sewing business by buying  more sewing machines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy firewood for sale.

loans.name: Jesús Enar

texts.es:
Jesús tiene 47 años de casado, es casado y tiene 4 hijos de 20, 18, 16, y 13 años de edad, vive en una comunidad del Municipio de Olanchito Yoro.
Don Jesús desde muy Joven aprendió junto con su padre a realizar trabajos de soldadura ha sido una tradición y patrimonio familiar. El pudo establecer desde hace 35 años su propio taller de estructuras metálicas y ofrece los servicios de fabricación de Balcones, verjas y otros accesorios derivados del metal. Su venta es por encargo y manifiesta que le ha ido muy bien en este negocio.
En la actualidad solicita un préstamo con ODEF de 7,000 lempiras para comprar una maquina de soldar la cuál le ayudara a solventar la demanda de trabajo y obtener ganancias favorables. 
Su meta en el futuro es fabricar muebles metálico para vender eso le ayudara a incrementar su capital.
texts.en:
Jesús, age 47, is married and has four children, ages 20, 18, 16, and 13.  He lives in a community in the Olanchito Yoro municipality.

When he was very young, Jesús learned from his father how to do soldering jobs.  It has been a family tradition and heritage.  Thirty-five years ago he was able to establish his own metal shop.  He makes balconies, iron fences, and other items made from metal.  His sales are by order, and he says that it has gone very well for him in this business.

He is currently requesting a loan from ODEF for 7,000 lempiras in order to buy a soldering machine.  This will help him meet the demand for his work, and it will help him get good profits.

His goal for the future is to make metal furniture to sell, which will help him increase his capital.

loans.use: to buy a soldering machine in order to make furniture from metal.

loans.name: Sumaya

texts.en:
Sumaya is a conservative person, and for that reason, she has asked her husband to take her place in the photo. 

Sumaya, 37 years old, is a housewife. Six years ago she started a small home products retail business. She used to sell, from their home, kitchen material like wipes, cleaning sponges and others. 

After her husband's retirement, they expanded by building a small stall in the market for selling those home products, cleaning products, and detergents. Having two location for selling, one at home, the other in the market, has helped in improving their living conditions.

Now Sumaya has applied for this loan to buy more products to increase their revenue and build a home products store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more home products

loans.name: Edina

texts.en: Edina is 37 years old, married and the mother of four children. She lives in the town of Kasese, Uganda, where she has earned a living for the last four years by running a retail business. Her main challenges are high fuel and transportation costs as well as a shortage of funds she can use to restock her store. She is applying for this loan to buy sugar and cosmetics to sell to her customers. Her goals for the future are to educate her children, expand her business into new markets and move her business to a new location.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and sugar to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 33 years old, married and the mother four children. She lives in Kasese, Uganda, where she has earned a living for the last 10 years by selling clothing. She started her business with 100,000 shillings but now has 300,000 shillings in working capital. Her hardships are customers who do not pay their bills on time and inadequate funds for buying new items to sell. Her goals for the future are to educate her children and expand into new markets. She is applying for this loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Aida Luz

texts.es:
Aida es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de sus 2 hijos de 12 años y 7 meses de nacido, por lo que ha tenido que venir trabajando fuertemente desde hace bastante tiempo con el ánimo de poder generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar. Aida desde hace aproximadamente 12 años montó su negocio de confección en el cual ofrece productos de muy buena calidad, lo que le ha permitido captar una gran cantidad de clientes y tener muy buenas ventas. Gracias a su negocio ha podido generar los ingresos para poder ofrecerles a sus hijos una buena calidad de vida y es por esto que sigue trabajando fuertemente para poder seguir teniendo un buen negocio. Con el ánimo de responder a los grandes pedidos que le han hecho sus clientes, y debido a que no cuenta con un gran capital, Aida busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de insumos y materias primas para la confección de sus productos y poder responder así a los grandes pedidos que le han hecho sus clientes.
De esta manera podrá seguir creciendo en su negocio ofreciendo buenos productos a sus clientes y así seguir generando los ingresos necesarios para su hogar. Además, Aida sueña con que su negocio le brinde la oportunidad de tener una buena calidad de vida y en un futuro poder conseguir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Aida is a single mother and head of the household. She has two children aged 12 years and seven months. She has had to work very hard for a long time to be able to earn enough money to support them and pay the household bills. 

Approximately twelve years ago, Aida started making good-quality clothing and was able to attract a large number of customers and made many sales. Because of this business, she has been able to earn enough money to offer her children a good standard of living. She wishes to continue with this work and maintain a good business. 

As she wishes to respond to the many orders of her customers and because she lacks capital, Aida is seeking a loan to buy supplies and other materials to make clothing. In this way she can continue to offer good products to her customers and earn an income to support her family. Her hope is that her business will continue to allow her to have a good standard of living and that in the future she will be able to buy a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make clothing

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan, 50 years old and a married woman, has four sons.

Since her husband's retirement salary is not enough to support the whole family, Hanan has chosen to sell glasses cases, glasses wipes, and contact lenses. Why she chose to sell those item, based on what she says, is that most home retailers sell clothes and home products, and she wanted to be different. 

In the future, Hanan hopes that she can open an optics shop. But now she has applied for this loan to increase the quantity of goods she has and bring in more sunglasses.

loans.use: to increase the inventory she has and bring in more sunglasses

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel tiene 36 años de edad, es casado, tiene 3 hijos de 10, 4 y 1 año de edad, vive en el Municipio de San Francisco del Departamento de Atlántida.
El señor Daniel se dedica al comercio. Hace 16 años estableció un negocio de venta de CDS de toda variedad de películas, vende relojes, lentes, carteras y fajas. El vende su mercadería en un pequeño puesto en el centro de la ciudad. Considera que este negocio es rentable y sus ingresos han mejorado y con las ganancias que obtiene ha podido seguir reinvirtiendo. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo con ODEF de 15,000 lempiras para comprar relojes, lentes para el sol, carteras y fajas de caballero. Esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar sus ingresos.
Su meta a seguir es construir el cerco de su casa, y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Daniel, age 36, is married and has three children, ages 10, 4, and 21.  He lives in the San Francisco municipality in the Atlántida department.

Daniel devotes himself to commerce.  Sixteen years ago he established a business of selling CDs of all kinds of movies.  He also sells watches, glasses, wallets, and belts.  He sells his merchandise at a small stand in the center of the city.  He considers this business to be profitable, and his income has improved.  With the earnings that he gets he has been able to continue reinvesting.

He is requesting a loan from ODEF for 15,000 lempiras.  He will use the loan to buy watches, sunglasses, wallets, and men’s belts.  This investment will help him increase his income.

His goal is to continue building the fence around his house and to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy watches, sunglasses, wallets, and men’s belts to stock his business.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en: Hanan, 47 years old and a married woman, has a talent making straw baskets. When she decided to turn this talent into a business she looked for ways to improve her handicrafts, so she started to make trays, vases, and picture frames all from straw. Now Hanan want to add beads to her crafts so she has applied for this loan to buy beads, decorating fabric and accessories, and more straw to create new crafts and enhance the ones she has.

loans.use: to buy beads, decorating fabric and accessories, and more straw

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is 27 years old, married and the mother of one child. She earns a living by selling various goods, including juice, biscuits, soap, sugar and lotions. She has been in this business for two years and runs her company from 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. every day except Sunday. She is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to buy more food items and lotions to sell to her customers. She plans to use the additional profits she earns to save for the future and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy various food items and lotions to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Francois

texts.en: Francois is 54 years old, married and the father of five children. For the last three years, he has earned a living by selling spare parts. His business is open from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. every day of the week. He has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to buy more spare parts to sell to his customers. He will use his profits to reinvest in his business and pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Veronica Janneth

texts.es: Verónica es casada tiene 32 años de edad. Nació en Milagros tiene 1 hijo de edad escolar que asiste a la escuela pública. Su esposo es chofer y juntos adquirieron su casa hace 10 años. Su mamá le enseño desde pequeña a coser por la cual al crecer formaron un negocio familiar. Verónica termino la secundaria pero indica que es  difícil encontrar trabajo y por ese motivo no siguió la universidad. Nunca pensó que lo que empezó como un negocio pequeño para solventar sus gastos se convirtiera en un medio de vida para ella y sus familiares. En la actualidad el único problema que se presenta es la delincuencia. El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar telas e hilos para la confección de pantalones, camisas, sabanas y aumentar su producción. Su sueño inmediato es abrir un local creciendo como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Verónica is 32 years old and married. She was born in Milagros and her son attends public school. Her husband is a chauffeur and together they acquired their home 10 years ago. As a young girl, Verónica learned how to sew from her mother and she used that skill to start a family business. After finishing high school, Verónica said that it was difficult to find a job so she decided not to continue on to university. She never thought that the small business that she started to cover her expenses would become the means of support for herself and her family. At the moment, the only problem she faces is crime.

Verónica will use this loan to buy fabrics and thread for making trousers, shirts, and bedding so as to increase her production. Her immediate dream is to open a shop where she can grow as a micro-entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and thread in order to make trousers, shirts, and bedding.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 28 years old and is married with 2 children. She sells various goods such as cassava flour, cooking oil, sugar, etc. and she has been in this business for one year. Her business is open from 7 am to 6 pm per week except on Sunday. 

Beatrice has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods such as cassava flour, cooking oil, sugar, etc. to sell. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future and she will be able to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase various goods such as cassava flour, cooking oil, sugar, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Margarita De Jesus

texts.es:
Margarita es una persona que ha tenido que atravesar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo sus ganas de trabajar y salir adelante le han permitido superar estas dificultades y continuar progresando en su vida. Madre soltera cabeza de familia de su único hijo, pues se separó de su esposo desde hace un largo tiempo, Margarita ha tenido que trabajar fuertemente para poder generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar. Hace aproximadamente 10 años Margarita inició una venta de comidas rápidas, negocio con el cual generaba ingresos para su hogar y con el cual podían tener una buena calidad de vida, sin embargo, por circunstancias ajenas a su voluntad se vio en la obligación de cerrarlo. Actualmente, Margarita desea reabrir su negocio de venta de comidas rápidas, por lo que busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de comprar un asador grande, utensilios de cocina necesarios e insumos para reabrir su negocio de venta de comidas rápidas.
De esta manera logrará reiniciar su negocio y volverá a generar los ingresos para su hogar, con lo que podrá ofrecer a su hijo una buena calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades de acceder a una mejor educación.
texts.en:
Margarita is a person who has had to overcome many adversities in her life. Nevertheless, her advances at working and getting ahead have permitted her to overcome these difficulties and continue progressing in life. She has been a single mother and head of a family with one child since separating from her husband a long time ago. Margarita has had to work hard to be able to generate the income necessary to cover household expenses.

Approximately 10 years ago, Margarita began selling fast food, a business that allowed her to generate income for her home and achieve a decent quality of life. Nonetheless, due to circumstances beyond her control, she was obliged to close it. Now, Margarita wants to re-open her fast food business. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy a large roaster, kitchen utensils, and necessary supplies for re-opening her fast-food-selling business.

In this way, she can start her business anew and, once again, generate income for her home. With this loan, she can also offer her son a good quality of life and greater opportunities of access to  better education.

loans.use: buy a large roaster, kitchen utensils, and supplies necessary to re-open her fast food business.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is 46 years old and a married woman. Her husband is a salesman at a crafts institution. They have three sons and a daughter.

Iman is known for the crafts she makes whether it be from stone, fabric, or even glass. Using her husband's experience since he works as a salesman for a similar institution, Iman has learned how to market for her crafts and sell them.

Now she has applied for this loan in order to buy a new stone saw and paints to enhance her creations and make new sorts of crafts.

loans.use: to buy a new stone saw and paints

loans.name: Shireen

texts.en:
Shireen is 34 years old and a married woman. Her husband is an automotive electrician.

Shireen has a clothing sales business, and she also sells different types of bed covers. Now she wants to include the sale of perfumes and accessories to add variety in the products she sells. For that reason, she has applied for this loan.

She hopes that in the future she can have her own clothing store.

loans.use: to add the sale of perfumes and accessories

loans.name: Gs Brisas De Oriente Group

texts.es:
El Señor Jairo, tiene 36 años de edad tiene 3 hijos, Su actividad principal es la venta de abarrotería (pulpería) desde hace más de 6 años, el cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa, Don Jairo solicitando el apoyo del préstamo para la compra de productos como ser: azúcar, manteca, jabón, refrescos, carnes, papel higiénico maíz frijoles y otros productos de consumo para la atención de sus clientes, su negocio esta ubicado en la calle principal, de la comunidad donde el vive, Don Jairo también vende de manera ambulante, en su motocicleta en algunas comunidades de la zona, el es una persona muy trabajadora y ha sabido salir adelante con su negocio, con el préstamo solicitado Don Jairo, le contribuirá a tener un mejor negocio, y así obtener mejores ingresos para cubrir los gastos en el hogar y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
El Señor José, se dedica al comercio, su actividad principal es la venta de abarroteria (pulpería) y venta de verduras.
La Señora Wendy, se dedica al comercio, su actividad principal es la venta de  golosinas tamalitos, fritas, atoles.
Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - Abril 2012
texts.en:
Sr. Jairo is 36-years old and has three children. His main job for more than six years has been selling groceries in his small store. His wife helps him.

Jairo is now seeking a loan to buy products such as sugar, butter, soap, soft drinks, meats, toilet paper, corn, beans etc. to sell to his customers. His business is located on the main street in the community where he lives. He also travels to other local communities on his motorcycle to sell his products. He is a hardworking man and has a successful business. The loan money will help him to have an even better business and earn the money he needs to pay the household bills and provide a better quality of life for his family.

Sr. José is also a businessman selling groceries and vegetables.

Sra. Wendy runs a business selling candy, tamales, fried goods, and atole (a corn-based drink).

loans.use: to buy sugar, butter, soap, soft drinks, meats, toilet paper, corn, beans etc.

loans.name: Seth

texts.en:
Seth is 38 years old and is married with two children. He sells various food such as cooking oil, sugar, juice, soap, water, etc. and he has been in this business for one year. His business is open from 7 am to 7 pm per week and he currently employs two people to help him. 

Seth has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various food such as cooking oil, sugar, juice, soap, water, etc. to sell. With any profits, Seth will be able to save for his future and he will be able to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as cooking oil, sugar, juice, soap, water, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Vedaste

texts.en:
Vedaste is 32 years old and is single. He owns a stationery business selling books and other materials and he has been in this business for two years. His business is open from 8 am to 6 pm per week and he currently employs two people to help him. 

Vedaste has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his stationery business by buying more books, more materials, etc.  for resale. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future and he will be able to reinvest in his business

loans.use: To expand his stationery business by buying more books and materials for resale.

loans.name: Illuminee

texts.en:
Illuminee is 36 years old and is married with three children and she takes care of one dependent who is four years. She sells bags and she has been in this business for 4 years. Her business is open from 7 am to 6 pm per week except on Sunday. 

Illuminee has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more bags for resale. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future and she will be able to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more bags for resale.

loans.name: Theonille

texts.en:
Theonille is 39 years old and is married with three children. She sells various goods such as sugar, biscuits, salt, cooking oil, etc. and she has been in this business for one year. Her business is open from 6:30 am to 5 pm per week. 

Theonille has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods such as sugar, biscuits, salt, cooking oil, etc. to sell. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future and she will be able to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as sugar, biscuits, salt, cooking oil, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Augustin

texts.en:
Augustin is 30 years old and is married with two children. He sells various food such as beans, sorghum, potatoes, etc. and he has been in this business for 2 years. His business is open from 7 am to 7 pm per week and he currently employs two people to help him. 

Augustin has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various food such as beans, sorghum, potatoes, etc. to sell. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future and he will be able to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase various food such as beans, sorghum, potatoes, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 46 years old and is married with one child. She owns an arts business and she has been in this business for 2 years. Her business is open from 8 am to 5 pm per week and she currently employs one person to help her. 

Nora has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her arts business by buying more materials to use in her arts for getting more profits. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future and she will be able to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To expand her arts business by buying more materials to use in her arts

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 45 years old, married and the mother of four children who are 28, 25, 18 and 15 years old. She has one additional dependent who lives with her because he is still in school. In 1991, Florence went into business selling foodstuffs. She began her business to help her husband support their family. Now she works seven days a week, 12 hours a day, and earns about Le 950,000 every month. She is requesting a loan for Le 5,000,000 to buy food items to sell to her customers, including bulgur, garri and cornflower. She has successfully repaid one loan  and hopes that this new loan will allow her to increase her profits by Le 300,000 a month. In the future, Florence plans to complete the construction of her house, buy a commercial vehicle and embark on an international business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy food items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Bainadu

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Bainadu. She is married and has 4 children, ages 22, 18, 15 and 12 all schooling. In 2007, Bainadu established her food stuff business. She began her business just to enable her to adequately support her children’s education and provide a solution to her domestic problems. 

Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 900,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Bainadu requires a loan in order to buy bulgur, garri and cornflower. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 250,000 SLL. 

In the future, Bainadu plans to complete the construction of her house, to support her childrens' education and to access more funds for her business expansion. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy food items for sale

loans.name: Kamara

texts.en:
This is 31-year-old Kamara.  He is married and has 3 children, ages 11, 8, and 5 years; all of them are school-going children. In 1996, Kamara established his used clothing business. He began his business because he wants to be self-reliant. 

Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about 900,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Kamara has already received and successfully repaid a loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy used clothing by the bail. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 350,000 SLL. 

In the future, Kamara plans to complete the construction of his house, to own a private car and to educate his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy bails of used clothing

loans.name: Sonou

texts.fr: Agée de 40ans et mère de 03enfants tous scolarisés, Madame Sonou est revendeuse de céréales. Elle s’approvisionne à Anié(une localité située environ 280 kilomètres de la ville de Lomé) et revend à la maison. Elle est aidée par 01 personne et par moment à des problèmes dans la livraison des marchandises. Elle veut ce premier crédit de WAGES pour acheter des céréales. Elle veut dans l’avenir diversifier les produits, et assurer les besoins vitaux de la famille. Notons que son conjoint est chauffeur. Son premier enfant a 14ans et le dernier 06ans. Elle a démarré son activité en 2003.
texts.en: Aged 40 and mother of 3 children all of whom attend school, Mrs Sonou sells cereals. She buys her stock at Anié (a locality situated about 280 kilometres from the town of Lomé) and sells it from home. She is assisted by 1 person and periodically has problems with the delivery of the merchandise. She wants this first loan from WAGES to buy cereals. In the future she wishes to diversify her products, and provide the basic necessities for her family. Her husband is a driver. Her eldest child is 14 and the youngest 6. She started her business in 2003.

loans.use: to purchase cereals.

loans.name: Gs Edo Group

texts.es:
La Señora Edelinda, se dedica al comercio, su actividad principal es la venta de abarroteria (pulpería) ella cuenta con  (5) años de experiencia. Ella cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, tiene 3 hijos, y solicita el préstamo para la compra de productos como ser: azúcar, manteca, jabón, refrescos, carnes, papel higiénico maíz frijoles y otros productos de consumo para la atención de sus clientes,  ya que ha sido una de las principales  fuentes de ingresos su negocio esta ubicado en su casa, Doña Edelinda se levanta muy temprano para atender a sus clientes, y para preparar a sus hijos para mandarlos a la escuela.
Doña Edelinda su sueño es que sus hijos se gradúen y que su negocio crezca para darle una mejor vida a su familia.
La Señora Darlyn se dedica al comercio su actividad principal es la venta de enchiladas y el corte de pelo.
La Señora Ofelia, se dedica  al comercio, su actividad principal es la venta de abarroteria (pulpería).
Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - Abril 2012
texts.en:
Sra. Edelinda runs a grocery store, a job she has had for five years. Her husband helps her in the store. She has three children. Edelinda is seeking a loan to buy sugar, butter, soap, soft drinks, meats, toilet paper, corn, beans etc. to sell to her customers. The store is one of the main sources of income for Edelinda, and she runs it out of her home. She gets up early to serve her customers and get her children ready for school. Her hopes are that her children will graduate from school and that her business grows so that the family can have a better life.

Sra. Darlyn sells enchiladas and is also a hairdresser.

Sra. Ofelia runs a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy sugar, butter, soap, soft drinks, meats, toilet paper, corn, beans etc.

loans.name: Abass

texts.en:
This is 51-year-old Abass. He is married and has 5 children, ages 22, 20, 18, 16 and 14 years. He has 3 additional dependents who live with him because they are schooling. In 1997, Abass established his provisions business. He began his business because of self-empowerment and it provides a solution to all his problems. 

Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about 1,200,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Abass has already received and successfully repaid a loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy batteries, candles, sardines and sweets. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 250,000 SLL. 

In the future, Abass plans to educate his children, to build a house, to own a private car and to acquire a more spacious shop. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy provisions

loans.name: Unidas Para El Éxito Group

texts.es: La Sra. Pelagia de 43 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos los cuales aún dependen de ella. Tiene 3 años como socia de Edaprospo y se dedica al alquiler de cabinas de Internet desde hace más de 5 años. Comenzó con motivación por parte de su esposo, quien sabe sobre el manejo y ensamblaje de computadoras. También se dedica al servicio de costurera desde hace 2 años. Con su esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado comprarse muchas más maquinas para su local de alquiler. Su plan para el futuro es seguir creciendo con su negocio y terminar de construir su casa. Ella usó el crédito en la compra de 2 cabinas para su negocio. Actualmente su ingreso lo destina a cubrir los gastos de alimentación mientras que su esposo paga las cuotas del préstamo. Pelagia pertenece a la alcancía comunal “Unidas para el éxito”, el cual esta conformado por 7 personas y lleva el cargo de presidenta desde hace 1 año.
texts.en:
Pelagia is 43 years old, and lives with her partner and their two children, who still depend on her. 
She has been a member of Edaprospo for three years and has been working renting Internet booths for over five years. Her husband, who knows about computer use and assembly, motivated her to get started. She has also been providing seamstress services for two years. 
Through her effort and work she has been able to purchase many more machines for her rental business. Her plans for the future are to continue growing with her business and to finish building her house. 
She used the loan to purchase two booths for her business. Currently her income goes toward covering sustenance expenses, while her husband pays off the loan installments. 
Pelagia belongs to the communal bank Unidas Para El Éxito, which comprises seven people, and she has filled the position of president for one year.

loans.use: with the purchase of two Internet booths for her business.

loans.name: Mayah

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Mayah. He is married and has three children, ages 13, 9 and 7. 

In 2006, Mayah established his soft drinks business. Working seven days a week and 20 hours a day, he earns about SLL 270,000 every month from this business. 

Mayah requests a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Mayah has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy soft drinks. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 180,000. 

In the future, Mayah plans to further his education, own a house and rehabilitate his late father’s house. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Daniel from Krootown, Sierra Leone. He is married and has one child, age 1. He also has two additional dependents that live with him at home.

Daniel runs a clothing store. He sells shirts, jeans, bags, trousers, track suits and ladies dresses. He has been running this business for six years. He also works as a motor mechanic to increase his income. He works at his business 26 days per month, nine hours a day. He says the main challenge he faces is inflation.

Daniel has requested a loan in order to buy shirts, jeans, bags, trousers and ladies' dresses to sell. The extra income from this loan will allow him to improve his standard of living. 

In the future, Daniel plans to increase his savings and expand his business. He appreciates your support.

loans.use: To buy shirts, jeans, bags, trousers and ladies' dresses to sell.

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Abeer is conservative person and she is unwilling to upload her picture on the Internet, so the man in the photo is her husband.

Abeer is a 32-year-old married woman from Hay Nazal, Jordan, and a mother of two children.

Abeer makes accessories such as necklaces, and she is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to purchase materials needed for making accessories.

Abeer is looking to expand her business and her customer base.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for making jewelry.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Meet 25-year-old Ibrahim from Krootown, Sierra Leone. He is single and has one child, age 4. His child is currently in nursery school. 

In 2008, Ibrahim established his used clothing business. He works at the business seven days a week, 10 hours a day. He describes his biggest challenge as insufficient funds for improving his used clothing business.

Ibrahim requests a loan in order to buy more used clothing such as jeans, trousers, t-shirts and shoes. The extra income from this loan will allow him to educate his child. In the future, he plans to expand his business and build a house. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more used clothing such as jeans, trousers, t-shirts and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Zafar

texts.ru: Зафар добрый и трудолюбивый семьянин, который женат и на воспитании имеет четверых детей. Более 10 лет он занимается выращиванием лука, пшеницы, ячмень и огурцов. Имеет 1,70 гектар земли. В семье работает он сам. Зафар хотел бы получить займ для покупки  семян, минеральных удобрений и горюче-смазочных материалов. Зафар надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Zafar is a kind and hard-working family man who is married and raising four children. For over 10 years, Zafar has been growing onions, wheat, barley, and cucumbers on his 1.70 hectares of land. He is the only breadwinner in his family. Zafar would like to obtain a loan to purchase seeds, mineral fertilizers, and petroleum products. He is hoping for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers, fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 45-year-old married woman from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan, and a mother of five children.
Hanan sells blankets from her home. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to purchase more blankets for trading purposes. She is looking to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase blankets for trading purposes.

loans.name: Fatimah

texts.en:
Fatimah is a 54-year-old married woman from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan, and a mother of five children.
Fatimah sells blankets from her home. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to purchase more blankets for trading purposes. She is looking to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase blankets for trading purposes.

loans.name: Jitta

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Jitta. She is married and has two children, ages 12 and 8. She also has four additional dependents who live with her for schooling.  

In 1996, Jitta established her cosmetics and drinks business. She began her business because she wanted to be helpful to her husband in taking care of their children. This business is her source of survival. 

Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, Jitta earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000, which will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 300,000. 

In the future, Jitta plans to give her children the education they want by sending them abroad. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Jose Reinaldo

texts.es:
José tiene 51 años de edad, es casado, tiene 4 hijos d 26, 21,15 y 8 años de edad, vive en el municipio de Choloma. Cortes.
Don José se dedicaba a trabajar en la construcción. Pero el ingreso que ganaba no era suficiente para sobrevivir con su familia,  fue entonces que pensó trabajar en lo propio. Hace 1 año comenzó con su propio capital el negocio de un Taller de Ebanistería donde elabora mesas, sillas y espejos de madera para venderlas. Manifiesta que le ha ido muy bien con este negocio y hasta la fecha ha podido solventar las necesidades de su familia.
El solicito un préstamo de 20,000 lempiras para comprar materia prima como madera, pegamento, clavos etc. para la elaboración de las puertas, sillas y espejos. Para seguir vendiendo y obteniendo ingresos.
La meta que el tiene es poder extenderse en hacer variedad de muebles de madera para dar mejores opciones de productos a los clientes.
texts.en:
José, age 51, is married and has four children, ages 26, 21, 15, and 8.  He lives in the Choloma municipality in Cortes.

José used to work in construction.  However, the income he was earning was not enough for his family to survive on.  That is when he thought of working on his own.  A year ago he used his own capital to start the business, a carpentry shop.  He makes tables, chairs, and wooden mirrors in order to sell them.  He states that this business has gone very well for him.  So far he has been able to cover the family’s necessities.

He requested a loan for 20,000 lempiras to buy raw materials like wood, glue, and nails, etc.  He will use the materials to make doors, chairs, and mirrors in order to continue selling and getting income.

His goal is to be able to expand by making a variety of wooden furniture in order to give his customers a better variety of products.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like wood, glue, and nails, etc. to use to make doors, chairs, and mirrors

loans.name: Martha Elena

texts.es:
Martha se encuentra casada y tiene 3 hijos, y con el ánimo de brindarles una mejor calidad de vida decidió montar una tienda desde hace aproximadamente 8 años, pues el salario de su esposo no es suficiente para poder sostener todos los gastos que se generan en su hogar. Desde entonces, su familia ha podido tener una mejor calidad de vida y Martha ha podido brindarles a sus 3 hijos el acceso a una educación de mejor calidad. Gracias a la buena atención que ofrece en su negocio, sus ventas siempre han venido aumentando, y gracias a esto Martha busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de productos de la canasta familiar para surtir su tienda general y así ofrecer a sus clientes siempre una gran variedad de productos.
De esta manera sus clientes cada vez encontrarán mejor atención en su negocio y así sus ventas seguirán aumentando, de modo que su familia podrá seguir progresando y sus hijos tendrán la posibilidad de tener una mejor estabilidad económica para progresar.
texts.en: Martha is married and has three children.  Eight years ago, she decided to set up a store with the aim of providing her children with a better quality of life as her husband's salary wasn't enough to cover all their household expenses.  Since then, her family has been able to enjoy a better quality of life and Martha has been able to provide her three children with access to a better quality education.  Thanks to the good service that she provides in her business, her sales have been rising and, as a result, Martha is looking for a loan that will allow her to buy more basic household products with which to stock her store so that she can continue offering her customers a wide variety of products.  In this way, her customers will continue to receive better and better service in her store and her sales will continue to increase.  This will mean that her family will be able to continue making progress and her children will enjoy better financial stability which will allow them to make progress in life.

loans.use: to buy basic household products with which to stock her general store

loans.name: Julio

texts.en:
Julio, like many Peruvians, has worked in many trades such as tourism and handicraft sales. Now he has a business buying and selling fish. He purchases the fish from Lima and then sells them in Cusco. 

A loan will help Julio purchase a refrigerated car to transport the fish. He says that the car is very expensive and he has been looking for funds from a number of sources to accumulate enough capital. Julio, age 60, has two children who now live and work independently. 

Julio is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Comuzone I" in Cusco, which is located in the Andean mountains at 3,400 meters above sea level. The bank is in its 17th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerated car to transport fish.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a 32-year-old married with one child and is a teacher by profession. He has been in service for a period of 12 years. He would like to educate his children, have self education and build a permanent home. David wants a loan to buy iron sheets, sand, and cement for construction.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets, sand, and cement for construction.

loans.name: Kenny Rogers

texts.es:
Kenny cuenta con una edad de 31 años, el reside en su propia casa el  en San Lorenzo Valle, el negocio de Kenny es la venta de abarrotería como ser: lácteos, harina de maíz, jugos, huevos, pollo, jabón, manteca, aceite, asistin, gelatina. El cual lo realiza en su pulpería  ubicado a 2 casas de su habitación el realiza esta actividad hace ya varios años, Kenny esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de Maseca, refrescos, granos básicos, pollo, aceite, manteca, embutidos y otros productos de consumo básico y así surtir su negocio  ya que necesita tener mas producto  y poder aumentar sus ingresos  así las personas podrán encontrar los productos que necesitan de igual forma el podrá mejorar la demanda de sus clientes.
El sueño de Kenny es que su negocio siga creciendo.


San Lorenzo, Honduras-  Marzo - 2012
texts.en:
Kenny is 31 and lives in his own home in San Lorenzo Valle. Kenny sells grocery items such as: milk products, corn flour, juice, eggs, chicken, soap, butter, oil, Asistin-brand cleaner, and jell-o. His store is located two doors down from his home, and he has had this business for several years. Kenny is requesting a loan for the purchase of Maseca-brand corn masa mix, pop, basic grains, chicken, oil, butter, sausage, and other basic products to stock his business. He needs to have more products and to increase his income. This way, people will be able to find the products they need and he will see an increase in demand. 
Kenny's dream is for his business to continue to grow.

San Lorenzo, Honduras-  March - 2012

loans.use: to buy Maseca corn masa mix, pop, basic grains, chicken, oil, butter, sausage, and other basic staples for his business.

loans.name: Abdukahor

texts.ru: Абдукахор добрый и трудолюбивый человек, который женат и на воспитании имеет троих детей. Жена занимается домохозяйством. С 1997 года он занимается выращиванием лука, ячменя, гороха и огурцов. Имеет 6,95 гектаров поливных и богарных земель. В семье работает один и сам содержит свою семью. Абдукахор хотел бы получить займ для покупки семян, минеральных удобрений, горюче - смазочных материалов и скота. Абдукахор надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en: Abdukahor is a kind and hard-working person who is married and raising three children. His wife takes care of the household. Since 1997, Abdukahor has been growing onions, barley, peas and cucumbers. He has 6.95 hectares of irrigated and non-irrigated land. He is the only breadwinner in the family and takes care of them on his own. Abdukahor would like to obtain a loan to purchase seeds, mineral fertilizers and petroleum products, as well as livestock. He is hoping for your help and compassion.

loans.use: to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers, fuel and lubricants, and livestock

loans.name: Santa Ana

texts.es:
Santa Ana tiene 47 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 1 hija de 25 años, ella vive con su hermano y su hija en el Municipio de el Negrito Yoro.
Santa Ana tiene un negocio de una pequeña pulpería que la estableció hace 8 años en su casa. Ella inicio con su propio capital y con su esfuerzo y administración ha podido salir adelante. Ofrece productos alimenticios como Pollo, manteca, harina, arroz, azúcar, café, embutidos, lácteos, pastillas etc. Con el financiamiento que solicito de 20,100 lempiras, piensa mejorar su inventario abasteciéndose de productos como refrescos, pollo, golosinas azúcar, café, manteca etc. Para ofrecer a sus clientes los productos necesarios que tienen demanda todos los días en el hogar. Su meta es ahorrar una cantidad de capital para solventar en el futuro cualquier problema financiero o de salud.
texts.en:
Santa Ana, age 47, is a single mother.  She has a 25 year old daughter.  She lives with her brother and her daughter in the Negrito Yoro municipality.

Santa Ana has a small grocery store that she established in her house eight years ago.  She started with her own capital.  Through her effort and administration she has been able to get ahead.  She sells food products like chicken, lard, flour, rice, sugar, coffee, sausages, dairy products, and broth cubes, etc.

She is planning on using the requested 20,100 lempiras to improve her inventory by stocking products like soft drinks, chicken, candy, sugar, coffee, and lard, etc.  She will do this to be able to offer her customers the products that they need and use every day at home.

Her goal is to save money in order to cover any financial or health problem in the future.

loans.use: to buy products like soft drinks, chicken, candy, sugar, coffee, and lard, etc. in order to stock her store.

loans.name: Arles David

texts.es: Arles de 25 años de edad es originario de León, de oficio agricultor se dedica desde hace 4 años a la crianza de cerdos. Inicio su actividad desde muy pequeño ya que sus padres son agricultores relacionándose desde pequeño con la crianza de cerdos, hoy en día se dedica a lo mismo y de las ganancias que obtiene de la crianza de cerdos mantiene a su familia, en el negocio recibe el apoyo de su mama, sus productos los comercializa en su misma comunidad, sus expectativas son crecer, mantener el negocio y comprar sus suplementos  agrícolas. Realiza el préstamo  para comprar cerdos de desarrollo,  el crédito le ayudara ya que podrá comprar su animales, criarlos para después venderlos a un mejor precio y obtener ganancias, sus planes a futuros es sembrar y seguir con la crianza de cerdos.
texts.en: Arles, age 25, is from León. He has been a farmer for four years, raising hogs. He started working at a very young age because his parents are farmers; he has been involved in raising hogs since he was a child. Now, this is his job. His income from raising hogs supports his family. Arles' mother helps him with the business, and he sells his products in the community. His plans are for his business to grow and be maintained, and he wants to buy agricultural supplements. He has requested this loan for the purchase of hogs to raise. This loan will help him because he will be able to buy some animals and raise them to be sold later at a better price, for a profit. His plans for the future include planting crops and continuing to raise hogs.

loans.use: to buy hogs to raise.

loans.name: Carlos Samuel

texts.es:
Don Carlos, tiene 37 años de edad, el vive con su  madre, y es padre soltero tiene 2 hijos, Su actividad principal es la venta de mercadería, desde hace más de 10 años, Don Carlos esta. solicitando el préstamo para la compra de productos como ser: sandalias de mujer, sandalias de varón, cosméticos y otros productos para la venta a sus clientes, el realiza sus ventas de manera ambulante, en algunas comunidades cercanas a Danli, Don Carlos es una persona muy trabajadora, ya que su negocio a sido la principal fuente ingresos, El se ha ganado la clientela por su buena manera de atenderlos, con el crédito solicitado que reciba Don Carlos, le contribuirá a tener un mejor negocio, y así obtener mejores ingresos para cubrir los gastos en el hogar, y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, y así poder salir adelante, el trabaja  muy duro para contar con el patrimonio familiar
Don Carlos uno de sus sueños es tener una tienda de ropa en el centro de la ciudad.
Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - Abril 2012
texts.en:
Carlos is 37 years old. He lives with his mother and is a single parent with two children. For over ten years, his main activity has been selling merchandise.
Carlos is requesting the loan to purchase products such as: women's sandals, men's sandals, cosmetics, and other products to sell to his customers. He is a street salesman, and works in several communities near Danli. 
Carlos is a very hardworking person, since his business has been his main source of income. He has earned his customer base due to the good service he offers.
The requested loan Carlos will receive will contribute to him having a better business, so that he may obtain better income to cover expenses at home, and give his family a better quality of life. This will allow him to get ahead. He works very hard towards having a family estate.
One of Carlos' dreams is to have a clothing shop downtown. 
Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - April 2012

loans.use: to purchase women's sandals, men's sandals, cosmetics, and other products for his business.
